commit_message:
func tests: plumb tolerate_missing through to listing_empty

We started tolerating deleted containers still showing up in account
listings recently, but we've still seen the occassional gate failure.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-20 15:51:42.000000000', 'message': "tripleo-kernel: Workload protection

Provisioned computes should never, ever be rebooted since they can run
important workload.

Normally, tripleo-kernel is executed before nova.conf is created on new
scale in nodes. There are some situations where it will run after
nova.conf, for example if the kernelargs changes. In which case, we
don't want to reboot a compute node with possible workload.

Validating the presence of nova.conf is probably the fastest and easiest
check we can do.

Change-Id: Ib6140c8991469c950fd7e1b323c614103394e3f1
"}, {'created': '2021-07-22 15:18:18.000000000', 'message': "tripleo-kernel: prevent reboot when TSX flag was added

During the 16.2 upgrade path, we enforce the inclusion of tsx flag by
operators. If there was already kernelargs present, the node won't get
rebooted, but if it's a new KernelArgs, the node will get rebooted as
per the related bug.

We want to prevent the unexpected reboot of nodes with workload when
the TSX flag was added.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1975240
Change-Id: Ib6140c8991469c950fd7e1b323c614103394e3f1
"}]
commit_message:
tripleo-kernel: prevent reboot when TSX flag was added

During the 16.2 upgrade path, we enforce the inclusion of tsx flag by
operators. If there was already kernelargs present, the node won't get
rebooted, but if it's a new KernelArgs, the node will get rebooted as
per the related bug.

We want to prevent the unexpected reboot of nodes with workload when
the TSX flag was added.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1975240
Change-Id: Ib6140c8991469c950fd7e1b323c614103394e3f1

we are now looking to remove.  We are planning to remove this label to
avoid confusion like this (and switching stable distributions on jobs
unexpectedly).

commit_message:
Update Debian stable job

The "debian-stable" nodeset was never updated past Stretch; a distro
we are now looking to remove.  We are planning to remove this label to
avoid confusion like this (and switching stable distributions on jobs
unexpectedly).

Since this branch isn't supported on > stretch, remove the testing.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/opendev/base-jobs/+/802639
Change-Id: Ic868bf75e64bc27cbc912c6c0415439a8c9a1057

commit_message:
Increase the scaleup/startup tries

Currently we're using 10 tries + 20 seconds sleep. This has been
observed as insufficient in a number of environments.
Let's bump up the defaults to something that will cover most situations.

Seen also in rhbz#1978696

Change-Id: I08c072acf5d41197f139ae66f1ee05ebccf11542
Closes-Bug: #1938129

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-05 14:40:44.000000000', 'message': "Introducing the oslo_config_validator role

This role is intended to leverage the `oslo-config-validator` on each one
of the configuration files found on a deployment. The goal is to quickly
catch erroneous configurations.

When called manually, it will also be possible to generate a report
returning all the differences between the current configuration and the
default configuration

One last thing, it will also validate the values of some specific
settings, based on the invalid_settings dict in the configuration.
Because of that, we moved some checks in nova_event_callback to the
oslo_config_validator role.

NOTE(dvd): Removing backup-and-restore group from this branch as it's
not available prior to Wallaby.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.config/+/794815
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1940815
Resolves: rhbz#1940815
Change-Id: Id047fe378cf512b985c9d7478a991f11b280102b
(cherry picked from commit 4aaca32f19af6426a6f1eb6ea896e8d10458928d)
(cherry picked from commit 727625fe95077158843f4a274693b6343d1f1e01)

commit_message:
Introducing the oslo_config_validator role

This role is intended to leverage the `oslo-config-validator` on each one
of the configuration files found on a deployment. The goal is to quickly
catch erroneous configurations.

When called manually, it will also be possible to generate a report
returning all the differences between the current configuration and the
default configuration

One last thing, it will also validate the values of some specific
settings, based on the invalid_settings dict in the configuration.
Because of that, we moved some checks in nova_event_callback to the
oslo_config_validator role.

NOTE(dvd): Removing backup-and-restore group from this branch as it's
not available prior to Wallaby.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.config/+/794816
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1940815
Resolves: rhbz#1940815
Change-Id: Id047fe378cf512b985c9d7478a991f11b280102b
(cherry picked from commit 4aaca32f19af6426a6f1eb6ea896e8d10458928d)
(cherry picked from commit fab6429d98dbef835efc422b471a0cd795edfdb9)
(cherry picked from commit 727625fe95077158843f4a274693b6343d1f1e01)

commit_message:
Fix support for json-rpc in ironic

This fixes support for IronicRpcTransport and enables json-rpc
for undercloud ironic.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/802858
Change-Id: I9b7edee92a3aeadd093ff997d23d085d73a04960

commit_message:
Triggering the 'tripleo-ci-centos-8-undercloud-containers'

This job initiates checks defined in the 'tripleoclient.undercloud_preflight'
module, which use the 'validations_libs.validation_actions.ValidationActions' class.

Any issues, arising in the integration of the aformentioned modules,
should be detected during the job run.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I947f0bcc2d4a6152de41b1592dc51a3757f0a8af

subject: [ussuri-train-only] Use more recent version of ansible-lint
messages:
[{'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-07-08 22:42:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-07-09 06:55:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree with the reasoning behind this fix, in fact I have to thank you for pointing me in this direction.

That being said, if we are going to fix the ansible-lint behavior in the hook, we should do it consistently across the branches, see the links. Right now we are pulling different versions in almost every branch, and if we are going to bump ussuri, it should be to the version victoria uses, unless there is reason not to do it.

Ideally we should bump it in all stable branches, to the same version as in master.

https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L33
https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations/src/branch/stable/wallaby/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L33
https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations/src/branch/stable/victoria/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L33

The validation_init role auto generates the molecule.yaml file when

commit_message:
Add zuul.d/molecule.yaml file back in the yamllint ignore list

The validation_init role auto generates the molecule.yaml file when
adding a new role. But, due to [1][2], the to_nice_yaml filter is not
correctly indenting lists and will break the indentation every time a
new validation will be created.

This patch adds this file to the yamllint ignore list and provides a new
molecule.yaml sorted by job names as the validation_init role will
generate in a follow up patch.

Moreover, this patch enables the oslo_config_validator molecule job in
the check/gate as it was not added in the initial patch[3].

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/48865
[2] https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/issues/234
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-validations/+/789698

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iac63dc6f161a0e885110a246b68001522a6f62e3
(cherry picked from commit 41dcda85921b4a79a46eaccbe28f0fffd516e3cf)
(cherry picked from commit f798c56ba56c1fbda7f7c517044155d80e913ec2)
(cherry picked from commit 04c08718e6cb5a1a6fe646277c2ba5f0b308d21d)

commit_message:
oslo_config_validator: Setting container network to none

When spinning a container, podman_container defaults network to bridge
as opposed to docker_container that defaults to none.

This causes "Missing CNI default network" errors and doesn't run the
oslo-config-validator command as expected.

Change-Id: I4faeab61421a9dbd6e5e2ea92c7e64ab1467453b
(cherry picked from commit 9311c11823c4b9dbc29a3957bf760da6fb25c53a)

oslo_config_validator: Setting container network to none

When spinning a container, podman_container defaults network to bridge
as opposed to docker_container that defaults to none.

This causes "Missing CNI default network" errors and doesn't run the
oslo-config-validator command as expected.

(cherry picked from commit 9311c11823c4b9dbc29a3957bf760da6fb25c53a)

commit_message:
Run Ceph upgrade only once.

The ceph ugprade playbook was being called twice, which did spend extra
time for the test.

It should be enough to upgrade ceph only once.

commit_message:
Stop running minion for Wallaby+

With the switch to ephemeral heat for the overcloud, the minion is no
longer viable. This change updates the branches to only run T->V where
the minion should work and was supported.

Related-Bug: #1938539
Change-Id: I5855de77b700124be0d0332ebe6a3f80524c521e

Since the notification code only passes the network_id, we
can move the load of the network until after the
PRECOMMIT_DELETE notifier has fired.  This allows us to
remove the session expire and re-load of the network.

Change-Id: I39ab562bb3cd8d3f606cc609feb0009c83033a0c
Depends-on: Ib12986c25eda25970445169310c7c0334d6da49c
'}]
commit_message:
Re-factor delete_network() in base plugin

Since the notification code only passes the network_id, we
can move the load of the network until after the
PRECOMMIT_DELETE notifier has fired.  This allows us to
remove the session expire and re-load of the network.

Change-Id: I39ab562bb3cd8d3f606cc609feb0009c83033a0c
Depends-on: Ib12986c25eda25970445169310c7c0334d6da49c

subject: Add compute-nodes-az-sync spec
messages:
[{'account_id': 13178, 'date': '2021-02-03 16:37:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-03-04 23:09:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-04-21 09:27:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It may be my English but we keep using the wording "sync Juju with OpenStack" and this fails at telling me if it is "aligning Juju to OpenStack" or "align OpenStack to Juju". I even feel like "sync Juju with OpenStack" is giving me the wrong impression (it's giving me the wrong impression that we're aligning Juju to OpenStack). Feel free to ignore this and land as is if I'm wrong and this is non-ambiguous English.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-04-21 09:27:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ah and that being said, this looks good otherwise, thanks!'}, {'account_id': 13178, 'date': '2021-04-22 09:13:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> It may be my English but we keep using the wording "sync Juju with OpenStack" and this fails at telling me if it is "aligning Juju to OpenStack" or "align OpenStack to Juju". I even feel like "sync Juju with OpenStack" is giving me the wrong impression (it's giving me the wrong impression that we're aligning Juju to OpenStack). Feel free to ignore this and land as is if I'm wrong and this is non-ambiguous English.

I also fall into the same category of non-native english speaker.

As far as code is concerned, what we do is:
- Create OpenStack AZs exactly as they are reported by Juju nova-compute units.
- Add the nova-compute OpenStack hosts to their appropriate AZs.

For example: if the nova-compute/0 Juju unit reports "AZ1" via "JUJU_AVAILABILITY_ZONE" env variable, upon the new post-deploy nova-cloud-controller Juju action execution, the OpenStack hypervisor (represented by nova-compute/0) is added to the "AZ1".

I'm happy to rephrase here, if someone thinks that it doesn't reflect what code is supposed to do.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-04-26 17:47:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1:
> > 
> > It may be my English but we keep using the wording "sync Juju with OpenStack" and this fails at telling me if it is "aligning Juju to OpenStack" or "align OpenStack to Juju". I even feel like "sync Juju with OpenStack" is giving me the wrong impression (it's giving me the wrong impression that we're aligning Juju to OpenStack). Feel free to ignore this and land as is if I'm wrong and this is non-ambiguous English.
> 
> I also fall into the same category of non-native english speaker.
> 
> As far as code is concerned, what we do is:
> - Create OpenStack AZs exactly as they are reported by Juju nova-compute units.
> - Add the nova-compute OpenStack hosts to their appropriate AZs.
> 
> For example: if the nova-compute/0 Juju unit reports "AZ1" via "JUJU_AVAILABILITY_ZONE" env variable, upon the new post-deploy nova-cloud-controller Juju action execution, the OpenStack hypervisor (represented by nova-compute/0) is added to the "AZ1".
> 
> I'm happy to rephrase here, if someone thinks that it doesn't reflect what code is supposed to do.

I'm a native english speaker and it makes sense to me, however I can see the confusion. I think its worth rephrasing this for clarification. I think something along the lines of "Creates and updates Nova availability zones based on the Juju availability zone configurations"'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-07-31 02:30:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-03 16:37:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add compute-nodes-az-sync spec

It proposes an automatic way to sync the Juju availability zones
with the OpenStack availability zones.

Change-Id: I315ffbdb2a1a0ab993fca1c0f39f758b214a36ce
'}]
commit_message:
Add compute-nodes-az-sync spec

It proposes an automatic way to sync the Juju availability zones
with the OpenStack availability zones.

Change-Id: I315ffbdb2a1a0ab993fca1c0f39f758b214a36ce

commit_message:
Add to test_server.go an http query option for response codes

Usage example:

$ wget http://localhost:9090/response?code=911 --server-response
  HTTP/1.1 911 status code 911

$ wget http://localhost:9090/response?code=BAD-INPUT --server-response
  HTTP/1.1 422 Unprocessable Entity

$ wget http://localhost:9090/response --server-response
  HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found

Signed-off-by: Noam Manos <nmanos@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie448a258b8171dd2695eb8ef9e7bbf968d9542be

commit_message:
Switch default system under test to CentOS 8 Stream

It is important for projects to do their main CI/CD primarily on the
most common environment used by operators.

The majority of the current participating Octavia community seem to be
running Octavia workloads on CentOS/RHEL operating systems based on
multiple conversations held on IRC and community events. Also according
to the OpenStack User Survey 2019 [1], a combined 55% of OpenStack cloud
deployments run mainly on these operating systems.

CentOS 8 Stream is one of two LTS or stable distributions for Xena [2].
This qualifies it to be a candidate to be the main distribution in our
CI jobs.

This patch changes the default nodeset for master jobs to CentOS 8
Stream.
Future stable branches (stable/xena onwards) will also test on CentOS
8 Stream. Existing stable branches will be left untouched.

[1] https://www.openstack.org/analytics
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/xena.html

Change-Id: I2eff691478cea7372f7b71e1412e65a7a2d6f2c4

subject: Add service dependencies to Octavia
messages: [{'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2021-02-18 14:00:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2021-02-18 14:02:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-07-31 02:32:04.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Brian Haley.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-18 14:00:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add service dependencies to Octavia

Octavia depends on OpenStack services like Nova, Neutron and Glance to
service properly. Octavia should not be started before these dependency
services are up.

An example we have seen multiple times where service startup order is
relevant is when all controller nodes are rebooted at the same time.
The Octavia Health Manager starts before the network dataplane is wired,
times out waiting for amphorae to check in (via Neutron tenant network
lb-mgmt-net) and triggers amphora failover. The failover flow
then fails because Neutron is still unavailable.

Presently, the 'depends_on' list translates to the "Wants=" systemd
directive. This is not ideal because "Wants=" is less strict than he
"Requires=" directive, i.e. systemd will attempt to start any units
listed there but continue with the current unit if the dependency units
are not found or fail to start. Yet, "Wants=" is better than what we
have today.

Change-Id: I1c1caf79011a10a9e8c7cafca7a68d8ef5ae26d0
'}]
commit_message:
Add service dependencies to Octavia

Octavia depends on OpenStack services like Nova, Neutron and Glance to
service properly. Octavia should not be started before these dependency
services are up.

An example we have seen multiple times where service startup order is
relevant is when all controller nodes are rebooted at the same time.
The Octavia Health Manager starts before the network dataplane is wired,
times out waiting for amphorae to check in (via Neutron tenant network
lb-mgmt-net) and triggers amphora failover. The failover flow
then fails because Neutron is still unavailable.

Presently, the 'depends_on' list translates to the "Wants=" systemd
directive. This is not ideal because "Wants=" is less strict than he
"Requires=" directive, i.e. systemd will attempt to start any units
listed there but continue with the current unit if the dependency units
are not found or fail to start. Yet, "Wants=" is better than what we
have today.

Change-Id: I1c1caf79011a10a9e8c7cafca7a68d8ef5ae26d0

commit_message:
Fix listener delete with missing certificates

When certificates were deleted in barbican, the listener using the
missing certificates cannot be deleted due to the processing certs
exceptions. But any way, we should still be able to delete the
listener.

Change-Id: I34bfa4ee7e1483419f9a0777acce7697d14a27fa
Story: 2008483
Task: 41529

commit_message:
Start more services in parallel

This starts nova api, ovn, placement in the background while we
start and configure neutron in the main thread.

Change-Id: Ib6bbe6943abc13bcb6730bc3248b98f3d351fd49

commit_message:
Mark microversion 1.37 supported

Microversion 1.37 adds support for re-parenting and un-parenting RPs.
The client supports these operations with the new microversion out of
the box. So this patch just marks the microversion as supported.

Story: 2008764
Task: 42132
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/placement/+/784020
Change-Id: I62f5a620e6639c29d4a8ed99f7e42b72f7af1a74

commit_message:
Expose *_allocation_ratio config

This commit exposes allocation ratio configuration via the cloud-compute
relation for backwards compatiable behaviour of the charms when
configuration of allocation ratios is delegated to nova-compute.

Closes-Bug: #1677223
Change-Id: I5a6bd1fa06d06dfd3e49182cc72ad83025429b13

messages:
[{'account_id': 33592, 'date': '2021-07-29 18:36:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 33592, 'date': '2021-07-29 18:44:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28719, 'date': '2021-07-30 14:39:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Any reason why we can't REVOKE ALL ON DATABASE .. FROM PUBLIC?"}, {'account_id': 33592, 'date': '2021-07-30 17:21:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> Any reason why we can't REVOKE ALL ON DATABASE .. FROM PUBLIC?

I initially avoided that because I wasn't confident that that was safe, whereas I was 100% sure revoking connect was safe. However, after some research, I am now confident that revoking all is safe as well. The public role is granted very few privileges by default, and all other database roles we use match or exceed what is granted to the public role. Therefore, no roles should suffer any impact by revoking all from public. Please review the next patch set update, as it will include this fix."}, {'account_id': 33592, 'date': '2021-07-30 17:21:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28719, 'date': '2021-07-30 17:34:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18250, 'date': '2021-07-30 18:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2021-07-30 18:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22214, 'date': '2021-07-30 19:53:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29298, 'date': '2021-07-30 21:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28235, 'date': '2021-07-30 21:46:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28275, 'date': '2021-07-30 21:49:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29585, 'date': '2021-07-30 21:50:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2021-07-30 22:00:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Limit Ceph OSD Container Security Contexts

Wherever possible, the ceph-osd containers need to run with the
least amount of privilege required. In some cases there are
privileges granted but are not needed. This patchset modifies
those container's security contexts to reduce them to only what
is needed.

Change-Id: I0d6633efae7452fee4ce98d3e7088a55123f0a78

commit_message:
Limit Ceph Provisioner Container Security Contexts

Wherever possible, the ceph-provisioner containers need to run
with the least amount of privilege required. In some cases there
are privileges granted but are not needed. This patchset modifies
those container's security contexts to reduce them to only what
is needed.

Change-Id: I74bd31df4af5cacc26834e645b0816bf285e8428

subject: Skip octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2
messages:
[{'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2021-07-22 19:33:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2021-07-22 19:44:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is not an Octavia failure.
The test is failing in the setup class before the Octavia tests start.
Nova is taking over 13 minutes to boot a VM in this test environment which is causing the test framework to timeout.
The VM does eventually successfully boot and Octavia has no errors. It just took longer than tempest is willing to wait with the current configuration.
I would not recommend skipping this test as others that use VMs will likely fail as well.'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2021-07-23 12:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

" would not recommend skipping this test as others that use VMs will likely fail as well."
It skips all tests with that pattern so there is no danger of the others failing.

See testproject run'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2021-07-30 21:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

subject: Fix spec tests using the deprecated pacemaker_restart_resource? function
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-30 12:52:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix spec tests using the deprecated pacemaker_restart_resource? function

Currently we get the following error:

  1) pcmk_common functions pcmk_restart_resource? stonith resource
     Failure/Error: expect(pcmk_restart_resource?('stonith-fence_ipmilan-stonith-fence-1', "cib-resource.xml")).to eq true

       expected: true
            got: false

       (compared using ==)

       Diff:
       @@ -1 +1 @@
       -true
       +false

     # ./spec/unit/puppet/provider/pcmk_common_spec.rb:41:in `block (2 levels) in <top (required)>'

Reason for this is that there are two functions to detect a change in a
pcmk resource:
- pacemaker_restart_resource? -> which parses crm_simulate and was
  necessary due to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1561617
  (Fixed in pacemaker-1.1.18-12)
- pacemaker_restart_resource_ng? -> which is the preferred one and uses
  crm_diff xml output.

The problem in CI is that crm_simulate output slightly changed and so
one test is failing. Since it makes no sense to call
pacemaker_restart_resource? with a working crm_diff (i.e. any pacemaker
> 1.1.18-12), we just make sure we do not run these tests on a working
crm_diff.

We plan to remove pacemaker_restart_resource? fully now that newton (and
el7) is unsupported, so this change is a minimal non-invasive fix for
the time being.

Closes-Bug: #1921118

Change-Id: Ic8a8e127004220bb8b6735b6cf8b4b52c03fa825
'}]
commit_message:
Fix spec tests using the deprecated pacemaker_restart_resource? function

Currently we get the following error:

  1) pcmk_common functions pcmk_restart_resource? stonith resource
     Failure/Error: expect(pcmk_restart_resource?('stonith-fence_ipmilan-stonith-fence-1', "cib-resource.xml")).to eq true

       expected: true
            got: false

       (compared using ==)

       Diff:
       @@ -1 +1 @@
       -true
       +false

     # ./spec/unit/puppet/provider/pcmk_common_spec.rb:41:in `block (2 levels) in <top (required)>'

Reason for this is that there are two functions to detect a change in a
pcmk resource:
- pacemaker_restart_resource? -> which parses crm_simulate and was
  necessary due to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1561617
  (Fixed in pacemaker-1.1.18-12)
- pacemaker_restart_resource_ng? -> which is the preferred one and uses
  crm_diff xml output.

The problem in CI is that crm_simulate output slightly changed and so
one test is failing. Since it makes no sense to call
pacemaker_restart_resource? with a working crm_diff (i.e. any pacemaker
> 1.1.18-12), we just make sure we do not run these tests on a working
crm_diff.

We plan to remove pacemaker_restart_resource? fully now that newton (and
el7) is unsupported, so this change is a minimal non-invasive fix for
the time being.

Closes-Bug: #1921118

Change-Id: Ic8a8e127004220bb8b6735b6cf8b4b52c03fa825

commit_message:
Move the upgrade prepare script generation in the build script playbook.

Currently, the overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh script was being built in the
overcloud_upgrade_prepare.yaml playbook to make sure the upgrade_prepare_extra_params
parameter was up to date. However, this parameter is not used anymore in
the ffu workflow and the upgrades workflow is not being used by our CI so
it should be safe to move it back to the create-overcloud-ffu-script.yaml.

Change-Id: I32494fb21d40cd3231e619c748fdfce7ff891f50

commit_message:
Add CephAdmDebug parameter

This change adds the cephadm debug parameter to allow operators to
set the debug related config-key and see a more verbose output.

Depends-On: Ic2e54e537b50cb92b1650e78f1af61703e877763
Change-Id: I9c3a38b828404b559ca4858e1d4e1297aa668301
(cherry picked from commit cf0b6a161c7425a149b453705b33f9f79fd08e87)

commit_message:
WIP: nova-audit: Use cliff instead of homegrown argparse bleh

There are a couple of advantages to this approach, chief among them
being the free docs and alignment with things like openstackclient.
cliff is added to requirements.txt, although it's really been a
dependency for many years now, albeit implicitly.

WIP because some of the PlacementHealAllocationsTestCase tests are
failing due to the following error:

  NotImplementedError: Cannot load 'database_connection' in the base
  class

Caused by:

  with context.target_cell(ctxt, cell) as cctxt:

Not sure what's changed here and why this wasn't happening before.
Missing configuration? I also need to finish converting the functional
tests.

Change-Id: I74e090e699bf1163b2038b2dc430d01e1625b01c
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-30 18:05:16.000000000', 'message': 'Preinstall requirements for docs build

Sphinx installs the package with its dependencies, but it does not use
the constraints. This can lead to errors if a dependency introduces any
backward incompatible changes. To avoid this the dependencies needs to
be installed prior to sphinx run by tox with the correct constraints.

Change-Id: I4ba83f1007dd11801b8e32c6d7566769e005480b
'}]
commit_message:
Preinstall requirements for docs build

Sphinx installs the package with its dependencies, but it does not use
the constraints. This can lead to errors if a dependency introduces any
backward incompatible changes. To avoid this the dependencies needs to
be installed prior to sphinx run by tox with the correct constraints.

Change-Id: I4ba83f1007dd11801b8e32c6d7566769e005480b

commit_message:
Move nova-manage db purge to nova-audit

This deprecates the 'nova-manage db purge' command and moves it to the
'nova-audit database purge' command. Associated tests are also moved and
documentation is copied across from the existing nova-manage docs.

Additional commands will be deprecated and moved in separate patches to
help make review easier.

Part of blueprint nova-audit

Change-Id: Idcd5f9b3ec67cb3c68d744b7f3a1b796f0829231

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-17 10:41:08.000000000', 'message': "placement-status: check only consumers in allocation table

Initially, _check_incomplete_consumers was intended to find the case
when consumers are mentioned in allocation but do not exist in the
consumer table. Due to a bug it's possible to have rows in the
consumer table those are not in the allocation table. The second case
it seems was not expected and it can be tricky to automate a cleanup
with zero touch upgrade.

This patch modifies the check such way it counts only consumers
presented in the allocation table.

related-bug: #1780799
Change-Id: I569043dd9f1c964faf7d4fcbb901a93f9569bf3d
"}, {'created': '2020-11-18 11:15:58.000000000', 'message': "placement-status: check only consumers in allocation table

This patch modifies the check such way it counts only consumers
presented in the allocation table.

it seems was not expected and it can be tricky to automate a cleanup
with zero touch upgrade.

This patch modifies the check such way it counts only consumers
presented in the allocation table.

Related-bug: #1780799
Change-Id: I569043dd9f1c964faf7d4fcbb901a93f9569bf3d
"}]
commit_message:
placement-status: check only consumers in allocation table

Initially, _check_incomplete_consumers was intended to find the case
when consumers are mentioned in allocation but do not exist in the
consumer table. Due to a bug it's possible to have rows in the
consumer table those are not in the allocation table. The second case
it seems was not expected and it can be tricky to automate a cleanup
with zero touch upgrade.

This patch modifies the check such way it counts only consumers
presented in the allocation table.

Related-bug: #1780799
Change-Id: I569043dd9f1c964faf7d4fcbb901a93f9569bf3d

commit_message:
Move nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows to nova-audit

This deprecates the 'nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows' command
and moves it to the 'nova-audit database archive_deleted_rows' command.

Associated unit and functional tests are also moved, as are docs.

Part of blueprint nova-audit

Change-Id: I9227827e2ad00e09ae2a95b74fbd60feb486ae67

commit_message:
Move nova-manage placement heal_allocations to nova-audit

This deprecates the 'nova-manage placement heal_allocations' command
and moves it to the 'nova-audit placement heal_allocations' command.
Associated unit and functional tests are also moved.

Part of blueprint nova-audit

Change-Id: I1704a16616e46b412a61c34ccec56f64dbf1eedc

commit_message:
Move nova-manage placement sync_aggregates to nova-audit

This deprecates the 'nova-manage placement sync_aggregates' command
and moves it to the 'nova-audit placement sync_aggregates' command.
Associated tests are also moved.

Part of blueprint nova-audit

Change-Id: I4967e80bb5a9399beafa5611997ba343d74d9094

commit_message:
Move nova-manage cell_v2 map_instances to nova-audit

This deprecates the 'nova-manage cell_v2 map_instances' command and
moves it to the 'nova-audit cells map_instances' command. Associated
tests and docs are also moved.

Part of blueprint nova-audit

Change-Id: If03d8682fec05c1fbdacd9a82568b31aabb5fe8d

commit_message:
Move nova-manage cell_v2 discover_hosts to nova-manage

This deprecates the 'nova-manage cell_v2 discover_hosts' command and
moves it to the 'nova-audit cells discover_hosts" command. Associated
tests and docs are also moved.

Part of blueprint nova-audit

Change-Id: Id09fadce7c36c70f4e5384c3fccc1879f8454187

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-23 11:22:19.000000000', 'message': 'Wait couple of seconds for dns servers to be set in the guest

In test
tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops.TestNetworkBasicOps.test_subnet_details
there is renewal of the DHCP lease made to configure dns nameservers.
And sometimes this test is failing due to missing nameservers in the
/etc/resolv.conf file in the guest VM.
After analyzing logs from such failed jobs I think that the reason of
that may be race between getting dns nameservers from guest VM by test
and actually configuring it inside the guest vm.
So this patch proposes to add wait (5 seconds by default) for non empty
list of the dns nameservers returned from the guest VM. That should
avoid such failures of that test.

Closes-bug: #1914229
Change-Id: I093ae5c11f88cc29e91285ff674788de53645b4e
'}]
commit_message:
Wait couple of seconds for dns servers to be set in the guest

In test
tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops.TestNetworkBasicOps.test_subnet_details
there is renewal of the DHCP lease made to configure dns nameservers.
And sometimes this test is failing due to missing nameservers in the
/etc/resolv.conf file in the guest VM.
After analyzing logs from such failed jobs I think that the reason of
that may be race between getting dns nameservers from guest VM by test
and actually configuring it inside the guest vm.
So this patch proposes to add wait (5 seconds by default) for non empty
list of the dns nameservers returned from the guest VM. That should
avoid such failures of that test.

Closes-bug: #1914229
Change-Id: I093ae5c11f88cc29e91285ff674788de53645b4e

Looks good, only the filter hint name in question.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2021-06-24 15:55:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

I support the general idea here but think we need to nail down the exact API changes proposed and be explicit about how the scheduler will handle "hints."  The tests you provide indicate that "hint" is actually a bit weaker than the scheduler behavior you want. If I say I want new share B on a different back end than share A, then that has to happen if the share is created at all.  And if I say I want it on the same back end, the scheduler cannot say "oh its just a hint" and schedule it on a different back end.  Or perhaps I've misunderstood your intent.  In any case I think the spec should make this explicit (I know the cinder spec did not).
When I provide a garbage hint to cinder ("cinder create --hint random-garbage 1") it is just ignored.  The share is created and available.  Is this really what we want?'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2021-06-24 15:56:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Voting, -1 not because I'm against the general idea, but because I think there are unresolved issues."}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2021-06-24 19:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Also, you mentioned in email database changes but I don't see mention of these here (?)."}, {'account_id': 20104, 'date': '2021-07-08 08:08:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1
> 
> (5 comments)
> 
> You've improved the specifiication of the hint semantics but as I indicate inline I think there is still some clarification needed.
> Also, you mentioned in email database changes but I don't see mention of these here (?).

Hi Tom,

Thanks for the feedback. Regarding DB migration - that is an open question.

Should the user be able to see the scheduler hints after the share has been provisioned successfully?
IMO - yes, because if that is not possible - scheduling new shares later on without knowing how previous shares were scheduled might become a pain, because the functionality is intended to be strict (e.g. fail on wrong configuration, see my other comment).

There are two ideas where to store the scheduler_hints - one would be in share metadata and second is to extend the share DB model. In case of metadata, we would need few more changes to prevent user from accidentally overwriting the respective metadata key.

Thoughts?

Thanks,
Dmitry"}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2021-07-08 11:05:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

I tend to agree with you that the hints should be visible after the share has been provisioned and that building this in the DB rather than overloading it into share metadata would be better.  Please add this proposal to the spec and mention the alternative in the Alternatives section so we can see what other reviewers think.'}, {'account_id': 20104, 'date': '2021-07-08 13:14:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 20104, 'date': '2021-07-08 13:17:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Dmitry, we discussed this spec today and Goutham and I agree that:

  a) the remaining issues should be resolved before we merge this (rather than merging and revising)
  b) we can continue to discuss/resolve and implement in parallel.  We"re for the overall  project and can work out stuff like use of metadata vs database before we merge (Goutham has some good ideas about using metadata rather than database but protecting it from casual deletion).

So, the spec won"t be formally approved till later but you can proceed with good confidence that your implementation work will not be wasted.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-07-15 00:22:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Hi Tom, Goutham,

OK, as for metadata vs database for hints storage - we actually already have own implementation which stores the hints in the metadata and prevents non admin users from deleting or modifying it. This was not hard to implement, yet it feels more like a workaround rather than a proper solution.

The version with DB storage is clearly way more work, but that is probably ok.
Let's please agree on something and finish the spec. I think that both hint storage options are viable.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-07-20 17:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> OK, as for metadata vs database for hints storage - we actually already have own implementation which stores the hints in the metadata and prevents non admin users from deleting or modifying it. This was not hard to implement, yet it feels more like a workaround rather than a proper solution.

Could you explain why this feels like a workaround? I linked our plans for expansion of resource metadata in this specification: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/manila-specs/specs/wallaby/metadata-for-share-resources.html#work-items - we did agree to tag metadata items as user modifiable or not across all user facing resources.

Using an existing key-value store like the metadata table makes more sense to me rather than a blob like proposed in this spec. 

> 
> The version with DB storage is clearly way more work, but that is probably ok.
> Let's please agree on something and finish the spec. I think that both hint storage options are viable.'}, {'account_id': 20104, 'date': '2021-07-20 19:55:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

I linked our plans for expansion of resource metadata in this specification: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/manila-specs/specs/wallaby/metadata-for-share-resources.html#work-items - we did agree to tag metadata items as user modifiable or not across all user facing resources.
> 
> Using an existing key-value store like the metadata table makes more sense to me rather than a blob like proposed in this spec. 

If I understand correctly, share metadata value is a string by default.

How would metadata look like if the user specifies let's say 3 shares for "different_host" and 1 for "same_host"?

-> the keys should be unique, so probably we could do something like:

   "metadata": {
      "__affinity_same_host": "UUID1,UUID2,UUID3",
      "__affinity_different_host": "UUID4"
   }

Then, in case of share migration or deletion -> the lookup becomes rather ugly and complex.
We could possibly save it as a single key called "scheduler_hints" with json value inside that would be dictionary keeping all that data. Yet, this also makes me think that in case of thousands of shares might lead to problems.

Please correct me if I'm wrong or missing the point. I've understood that there will be protected metadata feature as a part of other spec and it makes metadata more attractive to be used as a storage.

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-07-21 00:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> 
>    "metadata": {
>       "__affinity_same_host": "UUID1,UUID2,UUID3",
>       "__affinity_different_host": "UUID4"
>    }
> 

This could work; 

> Then, in case of share migration or deletion -> the lookup becomes rather ugly and complex.

I was thinking of this to work around complexity. Using your example:

1) Create Share 1 - it's got the ID: UUID1
2) Create Share 2 - it's got the ID: UUID2
3) Create Share 3 - it's got the ID: UUID3
4) Create Share 4 - it's got the ID: UUID4
5) Create Share 5 (assigned UUID5) with the scheduler hints provided above (same_host: UUID1,UUID2,UUID3, different_host: UUID4)

On receiving the request 5, we create the metadata records for share 5; and metadata records for the other four shares:

Share 1's metadata with "same_host" set to UUID5
Share 2's metadata with "same_host" set to UUID5
Share 3's metadata with "same_host" set to UUID5
Share 4's metadata with "different_host" set to UUID5

So, when the following events happen, this is how we can design this to work:

1) Administrator deletes "different_host" hint from Share 4 prior to a migration
We delete the "different_host" hint from Share 5 as well
2) User deletes Share 2, we delete UUID2 from Share 5's "affinity" hint (and drop the hint in the metadata if there's no value left) and proceed with deletion of Share2

what do you think

> We could possibly save it as a single key called "scheduler_hints" with json value inside that would be dictionary keeping all that data. Yet, this also makes me think that in case of thousands of shares might lead to problems.
> 
> Please correct me if I'm wrong or missing the point. I've understood that there will be protected metadata feature as a part of other spec and it makes metadata more attractive to be used as a storage.
> 
> Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 20104, 'date': '2021-07-21 10:05:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Ok, I got the idea.

What will happen when user provisions a share with multiple hints and share goes into Error state?
At what point in time is the metadata updated for Shares 1-4?

b) if we only set Share 1-4 metadata after the Share 5 provisioning is finished (becomes active) -> can this cause any issues for other share creation requests? (e.g. Share 6, Share 7, Share 8 that might have scheduler hints set too)

> a) right away on request started? - then we also have to delete all metadata on other shares in case of failure/error.

If hints are updated as soon as the share record's been created. If a share goes to "error" during provisioning or some point in its lifetime, cleaning up that share should allow deletion of metadata from related shares, wdyt? The advantage here is that we reduce the window for concurrency issues - i.e., the situation where further shares are created or existing shares are deleted during a share's provisioning.  

> b) if we only set Share 1-4 metadata after the Share 5 provisioning is finished (becomes active) -> can this cause any issues for other share creation requests? (e.g. Share 6, Share 7, Share 8 that might have scheduler hints set too)

I think this approach can work too, if we can carefully enable concurrent actions - Mitigating concurrency here would mean coordinating updates to the database via a reader-writer lock; Every metadata update of this sort will be coordinated; so after a share has been successfully created or deleted, we'd call for a metadata update across related resources; if a metadata update is in progress, the new update will wait until the previous update has finished. Before an update occurs, we must read the metadata and ensure we find it in a consistent state - i.e., no overriding updates have occurred (basically, when a hint was being added to Share4's metadata wrt a UUID3, if the Share3/UUID3 no longer exists, we just ignore the update). This doesn't sound too complicated - but is certainly a bit more complicated than doing it in the API layer as soon as the share record has been created. 

Thoughts?

> 
> > > We could possibly save it as a single key called "scheduler_hints" with json value inside that would be dictionary keeping all that data. Yet, this also makes me think that in case of thousands of shares might lead to problems.
> > > 
> > > Please correct me if I'm wrong or missing the point. I've understood that there will be protected metadata feature as a part of other spec and it makes metadata more attractive to be used as a storage.
> > > 
> > > Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2021-07-23 03:14:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)

hi, Dmitry Galkin.
thanks for this spec.
Here are some of my thoughts

i gree with Goutham Pacha Ravi to use metadata store "scheduler_hints".
rather than to to changing DB Share model, and we mark those metadata be "user_modifiable"
for example, the key value pair of scheduler_hints can be:
eg : scheduler_hint_same_host: share_uuid_1
     scheduler_hint_same_host: share_uuid_2
	 .
	 .
	 
	 scheduler_hint_different_host: share_uuid_3
	 
if we delete or unmange a share with uuid_1. We can easily find scheduler_hint information
corresponding to this ID from the metadata table.
eg : query.filter(or_(models.ShareMetadata.key == "scheduler_hint_same_host",
                      models.ShareMetadata.key == "scheduler_hint_different_host"))
					  .filter(models.ShareMetadata.value == "uuid_1")
	then delete those item. this will more structured storage, providing faster lookups.'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2021-07-26 01:58:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

vote +1,
But the implementation needs a bit of optimization.
thanks.'}, {'account_id': 20104, 'date': '2021-07-27 12:54:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 20104, 'date': '2021-07-27 13:04:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 10:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> hi, Dmitry Galkin.
> thanks for this spec.
> Here are some of my thoughts
> 
> i gree with Goutham Pacha Ravi to use metadata store "scheduler_hints".
> rather than to to changing DB Share model, and we mark those metadata be "user_modifiable"
> for example, the key value pair of scheduler_hints can be:
> eg : scheduler_hint_same_host: share_uuid_1
>      scheduler_hint_same_host: share_uuid_2
> 	 .
> 	 .
> 	 
> 	 scheduler_hint_different_host: share_uuid_3
> 	 
> if we delete or unmange a share with uuid_1. We can easily find scheduler_hint information
> corresponding to this ID from the metadata table.
> eg : query.filter(or_(models.ShareMetadata.key == "scheduler_hint_same_host",
>                       models.ShareMetadata.key == "scheduler_hint_different_host"))
> 					  .filter(models.ShareMetadata.value == "uuid_1")
> 	then delete those item. this will more structured storage, providing faster lookups.

Hi Goutham, Haixin,

Thanks for the feedback, much appreciated!

I've updated the spec:
- rely on metadata for hints storage, moved DB model change into alternatives.
- update the hints right away on creation/deletion of the share (point A from previous discussion).
- added a note about "force: true" option for migration.
- metadata should not be user modifiable, only admin modifiable.

Please let me know if there is anything else left for discussion.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-07-27 18:47:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

LGTM, thanks for walking through the design and making the changes!'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2021-07-28 01:32:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1

LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2021-07-28 10:25:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

Looks good.  Thanks for the extra time to figure out how to use the metadata rather than the DB.'}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2021-07-28 21:50:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Thanks for working hard in this spec. I went through the all comments in the review. I think that metadata approach is a good one too.
I added a comment on migration option which I think that can be messy.
Thanks'}, {'account_id': 29632, 'date': '2021-07-28 22:27:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

Looks good to me! Nice approach for a very useful feature for Manila.
Thank you for proposing this spec!'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-07-28 23:36:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 32594, 'date': '2021-07-28 23:56:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

I am working on the metadata spec that was proposed for the Wallaby cycle: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/manila-specs/specs/wallaby/metadata-for-share-resources.html

I could add "scheduler_hint_same_host" and "scheduler_hint_different_host" fields to my share_metadata table migration to preserve these values and incorporate this change.

But, why not use availability zones to group shares?'}, {'account_id': 20104, 'date': '2021-07-29 21:38:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 11:
> 
> I am working on the metadata spec that was proposed for the Wallaby cycle: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/manila-specs/specs/wallaby/metadata-for-share-resources.html
> 
> I could add "scheduler_hint_same_host" and "scheduler_hint_different_host" fields to my share_metadata table migration to preserve these values and incorporate this change.

I'd rather call it somewhat along: "__affinity_same_host" and "__affinity_different_host" as was previously mentioned in the comments.

> But, why not use availability zones to group shares?

AZ are unfortunately not enough. Even if we have 10-20 or more hosts in 2 AZ, there is a possibility of two shares being scheduled to the same host (or the other way around) when user wants a hard anti-affinity (or affinity). For example, a new host is added and all new shares in that AZ will be scheduled to it because it has the lowest utilisation and weighting mechanism affects the scheduling decision.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-07-30 18:31:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Workflow+1

(1 comment)

Thanks for the brainstorming and iterations on this everyone; lets take the pending concerns to code review; the spec can be updated to reflect the implementation details in the future'}]

At this point is nova's lifecycle, we're not going to change our ORM,
making the layer of indirection that is 'nova.db.sqlalchemy' is a
useless one. Start removing it with the 'migration' module.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
db: Move db.sqalchemy.migration to db.migration

At this point is nova's lifecycle, we're not going to change our ORM,
making the layer of indirection that is 'nova.db.sqlalchemy' is a
useless one. Start removing it with the 'migration' module.

Change-Id: I5fd6c6f74b7de2b422359cbe72defb07252e6b1e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2021-07-30 14:16:17.000000000', 'message': 'fix is_fedora for centos 8 stream

When deploying on the centos 8 stream variant
the output of "lsb_release -i -s" is
CentOSStream instead of CentOS

This breaks the is_fedora function in devstack
preventing package installation and removal.

Change-Id: I39ccefbd06f46adf5077f8d8001f37d3b190f040
(cherry picked from commit e7c017bd8998d9cc8c4712efe992239c73f340d1)
'}]
commit_message:
fix is_fedora for centos 8 stream

When deploying on the centos 8 stream variant
the output of "lsb_release -i -s" is
CentOSStream instead of CentOS

This breaks the is_fedora function in devstack
preventing package installation and removal.

Change-Id: I39ccefbd06f46adf5077f8d8001f37d3b190f040
(cherry picked from commit e7c017bd8998d9cc8c4712efe992239c73f340d1)

commit_message:
Rename x/tap-as-a-service to openstack/tap-as-a-service

Neutron team accepted to include tap-as-a-service as a stadium project
on last PTG (see [0] ~l212), for this tap-as-a-service (taas) must be
under openstack/ namespace.

The renaming includes only x/tap-as-a-service.
* x/tap-as-a-service-tempest-plugin: the tests should be merged to
neutron-tempest-plugin.
* x/tap-as-a-service-dashboard: unmaintained, and Neutron doesn't govern
Horizon plugins

[0] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/neutron-xena-ptg

Change-Id: Iaa6fc7b0a9dca20ea77637a3890c603837ac7014

[{'created': '2021-07-30 14:08:53.000000000', 'message': "Make test-setup.sh compatible with mysql8

Starting from mysql version 8 it's not possible to create a user
implictly when using GRANT.

This patch makes the behavior compatible with that.

Change-Id: Ia5a01089fe0eeb8fe0a1ec5a7cd0557835a46f9e
Co-written-by: Riccardo Pittau <elfosardo@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit b220030070adbea0bd253dfa390218d30b047154)
"}]
commit_message:
Make test-setup.sh compatible with mysql8

Starting from mysql version 8 it's not possible to create a user
implictly when using GRANT.

This patch makes the behavior compatible with that.

Change-Id: Ia5a01089fe0eeb8fe0a1ec5a7cd0557835a46f9e
Co-written-by: Riccardo Pittau <elfosardo@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit b220030070adbea0bd253dfa390218d30b047154)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-25 18:46:07.000000000', 'message': 'Remove cyclic import between export and utils

Because export imports utils and utils imports export
there is a cyclic import so pylint objects PEP8 R0401.

overcloud_deploy and overcloud_export need the function
export_overcloud which depends on export. The function
export_overcloud was added to utils for that import but
this created the cyclic import. To work around this,
redefine the export_overcloud function in export and
have overcloud_deploy and overcloud_export import it
from export, not utils. Then remove the utils import
of export.

Change-Id: I8bab41ee9af9729cd63ed7132928cfbc1770887a
(cherry picked from commit 3f6f67c106cbb48292a7bf6c07a3e7c7141936b5)
'}, {'created': '2021-07-29 13:52:57.000000000', 'message': 'Remove cyclic import between export and utils

Because export imports utils and utils imports export
there is a cyclic import so pylint objects PEP8 R0401.

overcloud_deploy and overcloud_export need the function
export_overcloud which depends on export. The function
export_overcloud was added to utils for that import but
this created the cyclic import. To work around this,
redefine the export_overcloud function in export and
have overcloud_deploy and overcloud_export import it
from export, not utils. Then remove the utils import
of export.

Change-Id: I8bab41ee9af9729cd63ed7132928cfbc1770887a
(cherry picked from commit 3f6f67c106cbb48292a7bf6c07a3e7c7141936b5)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove cyclic import between export and utils

Because export imports utils and utils imports export
there is a cyclic import so pylint objects PEP8 R0401.

overcloud_deploy and overcloud_export need the function
export_overcloud which depends on export. The function
export_overcloud was added to utils for that import but
this created the cyclic import. To work around this,
redefine the export_overcloud function in export and
have overcloud_deploy and overcloud_export import it
from export, not utils. Then remove the utils import
of export.

Change-Id: I8bab41ee9af9729cd63ed7132928cfbc1770887a
(cherry picked from commit 3f6f67c106cbb48292a7bf6c07a3e7c7141936b5)

commit_message:
PoC Move member policy checks to API layer

This change enforce member policy checks in API layer and disables
read-only checks at auth layer and disables policy layer as well.

ToDo:
1. Need to make this patch dependent on image policy refactoring (get_image)
2. Carefully verify read only checks at auth layer vs secure RBAC policy
3. Provide additional test coverage

Partially implements: blueprint policy-refactor
Change-Id: I52e9fbe5ef0e7c3021076d84e9b3df89012c45b9

commit_message:
Use payloads for PORT events

This patch switches the code over to the payload style of callbacks [1]
for PORT events for those that are not using them yet.

This patch is necessary since [2].

[1]https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/800604

Closes-Bug: #1938461
Change-Id: If55f0eb08c34e95ba5bc1865f7b6c107a86cd5af

commit_message:
Do not reset FSM when ironic ports cant be queried

It can cause problems, as if a single sync fails, FSM state will be
reset and not put back to initialized state until inspector restart.

Change-Id: I24b08612c4ffc6aca60ca08f3ff5cc769c7c041d
Story: #2008971
Task: #42611

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-30 09:59:37.000000000', 'message': 'Add missing default policy files for debian-binary-horizon

The debian-binary-horizon image is missing the default policies files
which should be in /etc/openstack-dashboard/default_policies. By copying
everything from /etc/openstack-dashboard/policy
into /etc/openstack-dashboard, we get the default policy files, as well
as commented out policy files (e.g. cinder_policy.yaml) and the
nova_policy.d directory containing api-extensions.yaml.

Change was merged for ubuntu in [1] but unfortunatelly
not for debian, this trivial patch fixes it also
for debian.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/794589

Closes-Bug: #1933759
Change-Id: I822d640a251e6ed9f71c76a922513e23e4218418
(cherry picked from commit 01d02be25ed043b4541db3ebfc102d013cdc578a)
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing default policy files for debian-binary-horizon

The debian-binary-horizon image is missing the default policies files
which should be in /etc/openstack-dashboard/default_policies. By copying
everything from /etc/openstack-dashboard/policy
into /etc/openstack-dashboard, we get the default policy files, as well
as commented out policy files (e.g. cinder_policy.yaml) and the
nova_policy.d directory containing api-extensions.yaml.

Change was merged for ubuntu in [1] but unfortunatelly
not for debian, this trivial patch fixes it also
for debian.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/794589

Closes-Bug: #1933759
Change-Id: I822d640a251e6ed9f71c76a922513e23e4218418
(cherry picked from commit 01d02be25ed043b4541db3ebfc102d013cdc578a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-07 10:43:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix crmadmin not working on masakari Debuntu images

As Masaari-hostmonitor is accessing /dev/shm/*, it
really needs to have same permissions as hacluster-pacemaker
container has (where crmadmin is working normally).

Problem is that permissions are different in above mentioned
containers in Debian/Ubuntu systems, and is caused by
Debian/Ubuntu way of creating users and groups - they are not
specifying uuids and gids as centos does (uuid/gid: 189).

Moreover above mentioned are built from different base images,
hacluster-pacemaker (base), masakari-hostmonitor (openstack-base).
So, there is no guarantee to have same uuids,gids in final images.

This patch is creating user/group right before package installation
and setting uuid/gid 189 as centos does.

Closes-Bug: #1934753

Change-Id: I1ad2cea4b920e22e743b147a1b5ad703af0ff6f6

commit_message:
Fix crmadmin not working on masakari Debuntu images

As Masakari-hostmonitor is accessing /dev/shm/*, it
really needs to have same permissions as hacluster-pacemaker
container has (where crmadmin is working normally).

Problem is that permissions are different in above mentioned
containers in Debian/Ubuntu systems, and is caused by
Debian/Ubuntu way of creating users and groups - they are not
specifying uuids and gids as centos does (uuid/gid: 189).

Moreover above mentioned are built from different base images,
hacluster-pacemaker (base), masakari-hostmonitor (openstack-base).
So, there is no guarantee to have same uuids,gids in final images.

This patch is creating user/group right before package installation
and setting uuid/gid 189 as centos does.

Closes-Bug: #1934753

Change-Id: I1ad2cea4b920e22e743b147a1b5ad703af0ff6f6

commit_message:
Add missing elasticsearch cloudkitty storage
and prometheus collector backend support.

* Fix various remaining typos.
* Fix trailing character on reno.
* Enable Elasticsearch when selected as cloudkitty backend.
* Add a check for ES index creation when ES required.
* Add a release note
* Fix release note line length issue.

Change-Id: I18f3d8f2e10a2996b2ebf92733a1770bef548bda
Closes-bug: #1895945
(cherry picked from commit 9e72c0cb4e2206cc72104648e507237977258d54)

[{'created': '2021-07-28 17:10:02.000000000', 'message': "[train-only] Don't auto-enable post-copy in DPDK deployment

PostCopy is conflicting with DPDK deployment unless ovs has been
configured to have the vhost interfaces supporting postcopy.

There's currently work on master branch to enable this [1] automatically
if required, but in the mean time, we need to disable this on the train
branch.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1986567
Change-Id: I6eaea6768d99e3b7667d86e5d65994bebb44190e
"}]
commit_message:
[train-only] Don't auto-enable post-copy in DPDK deployment

PostCopy is conflicting with DPDK deployment unless ovs has been
configured to have the vhost interfaces supporting postcopy.

There's currently work on master branch to enable this [1] automatically
if required, but in the mean time, we need to disable this on the train
branch.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1986567
Change-Id: I6eaea6768d99e3b7667d86e5d65994bebb44190e

commit_message:
Configure json_rpc/authtoken sections for ironic

Configure json_rpc section for both ironic-api and ironic-conductor.
JSON RPC service uses keystonemiddleware to authenticate with
keystone. Configure the keystone_authtoken section for
ironic-conductor as well.

[{'created': '2021-06-02 10:21:27.000000000', 'message': "New fix for rbd connector to work with ceph octopus

Found while testing cinder-backup with ceph on Ubuntu Focal, which
installs ceph Octopus.  Octopus apparently enforces the requirement
that the config file contain a '[global]' section for general
requirements.  The '[global]' section goes back at least to ceph
Hammer [0], so we will simply add it to the temporary ceph config
file that os-brick generates in the RBDConnector class.

[0] https://docs.ceph.com/docs/hammer/rados/configuration/mon-config-ref/

Co-authored-by: Alex Kavanagh <alex@ajkavanagh.co.uk>
Co-authored-by: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>

Change-Id: I86eb31535d990291945de5d9846b1a03157ec2cf
Closes-bug: #1865754
(cherry picked from commit c6ad4d864c6088b6686919dd0229c926bce7073a)
(cherry picked from commit 474583b4f8469f7957d6ffbf62829b516189aeae)
(cherry picked from commit 91c73a433a2b3675e661f1fe007b58c2bfaff757)
"}]
commit_message:
New fix for rbd connector to work with ceph octopus

Found while testing cinder-backup with ceph on Ubuntu Focal, which
installs ceph Octopus.  Octopus apparently enforces the requirement
that the config file contain a '[global]' section for general
requirements.  The '[global]' section goes back at least to ceph
Hammer [0], so we will simply add it to the temporary ceph config
file that os-brick generates in the RBDConnector class.

[0] https://docs.ceph.com/docs/hammer/rados/configuration/mon-config-ref/

Co-authored-by: Alex Kavanagh <alex@ajkavanagh.co.uk>
Co-authored-by: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>

Change-Id: I86eb31535d990291945de5d9846b1a03157ec2cf
Closes-bug: #1865754
(cherry picked from commit c6ad4d864c6088b6686919dd0229c926bce7073a)
(cherry picked from commit 474583b4f8469f7957d6ffbf62829b516189aeae)
(cherry picked from commit 91c73a433a2b3675e661f1fe007b58c2bfaff757)

[{'created': '2021-07-27 09:08:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix backup deleted but data not deleted

Use the admin user and project to delete the backup under other
projects. The request is processed successfully. The backup is
marked as deleted in the database, but the object data that constitutes
the backup is not deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1933443
Change-Id: Id5a655d3b10bd38682b25f31273ec9bcda5cc38b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix backup deleted but data not deleted

Use the admin user and project to delete the backup under other
projects. The request is processed successfully. The backup is
marked as deleted in the database, but the object data that constitutes
the backup is not deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1933443
Change-Id: Id5a655d3b10bd38682b25f31273ec9bcda5cc38b

commit_message:
Remove tripleo-operator-ansible from TQE requires

tripleo-operator-ansible will be installed from rpm from
stein onwards.

We no longer needs to install it from git, so removing it
from TQE requires.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5895d482f62e88ac8fd3a2443691ace1d1c86dfb

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-28 12:57:52.000000000', 'message': "Reproducer unit test for bug 1860312

Consider the following situation:

- Using the Ironic virt driver
- Replacing (so removing and re-adding) all baremetal nodes
  associated with a single nova-compute service

The update resources periodic will have destroyed the compute node
records because they're no longer being reported by the virt driver.
If we then attempt to manually delete the compute service record, the
datbase layer will raise an exception, as there are no longer any
compute node records for the host. This exception gets bubbled up as
an error 500 in the API. This patch adds a unit test to demonstrate
this.

Related bug: 1860312
Change-Id: I03eec634b25582ec9643cacf3e5868c101176983
"}]
commit_message:
Reproducer unit test for bug 1860312

Consider the following situation:

- Using the Ironic virt driver
- Replacing (so removing and re-adding) all baremetal nodes
  associated with a single nova-compute service

The update resources periodic will have destroyed the compute node
records because they're no longer being reported by the virt driver.
If we then attempt to manually delete the compute service record, the
datbase layer will raise an exception, as there are no longer any
compute node records for the host. This exception gets bubbled up as
an error 500 in the API. This patch adds a unit test to demonstrate
this.

Related bug: 1860312
Change-Id: I03eec634b25582ec9643cacf3e5868c101176983

commit_message:
Delete trait from placement

If no rp uses the old device trait, we need clean it, else placement
will raise 409 exception.

Closes-Bug: #1928174

Change-Id: I0b1a6ba0b8a9934afe243d53bc0eb7f78e97de1d

commit_message:
Fix Inventory Generation without Overcloud deployed

The utils.list_plan_and_stack function returns None in case of exceptions
or and empty list if no stacks or no plans have been found in the
environment.

This patch fixes the conditional to allow the tripleo-ansible-inventory
script to generate only the undercloud Inventory when no Overcloud has
been deployed.

Related-bz: rhbz#1987318

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If0dc3300fbd8cf245c0477be782110d897344860
(cherry picked from commit 5a8cfac7f98f15a2964ea7fcabb3d68a4355385e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-14 22:33:12.000000000', 'message': "wip: Cluster assisted Storage Policy Migration

Basically - just let the reconciler do it.  I'm interesting in how the
reconciler scales - migration of an existing full container is a little
easier to get at than forcing a split brain.

It might be useful even in a raw state under controlled and monitored
situations - but to be more generally applicable there's probably a
number of different concerns.

But this particular POC was just cause I wanted to hack on something
sorta fun - I got board around the time I realized I hadn't written any
unittests - but I'll throw it up and let it expire or maybe pick it back
up later or talk about the idea in Vancouver.

Change-Id: If559772b929f61a340c170569461312ff98cf751

commit_message:
wip: Cluster assisted Storage Policy Migration

Basically - just let the reconciler do it.  I'm interesting in how the
reconciler scales - migration of an existing full container is a little
easier to get at than forcing a split brain.

It might be useful even in a raw state under controlled and monitored
situations - but to be more generally applicable there's probably a
number of different concerns.

But this particular POC was just cause I wanted to hack on something
sorta fun - I got board around the time I realized I hadn't written any
unittests - but I'll throw it up and let it expire or maybe pick it back
up later or talk about the idea in Vancouver.

Change-Id: If559772b929f61a340c170569461312ff98cf751

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-23 15:09:33.000000000', 'message': "NFS: Update connection info on online snap create

The NFS snapshot creation for an attached volume requires interaction
between Nova and Cinder, and a new qcow2 file is used after the
attachment completes.

This means that the connection properties stored in the Attachment is no
longer valid, as it is pointing to the old qcow2 file, so if Nova tries
to use that attachment it will start writing on the old qcow2 file.

A flow showing this issue is:

- Attach NFS volume
- Create snapshot
- Hard reboot

After that the VM will start using the base image, breaking the qcow2
chain.

If we delete the snapshot in the meantime, then the VM will fail to
reboot.

This patch fixes this inconsistency by updating the connection info
field inside the remotefs driver.

We usually prefer that drivers don't to touch the DB, directly or
indirectly (using OVOs), but in this case we are using OVOs methods
instead of the usual model update on the volume manager because there
are cases in the driver where a snapshot is created (cloning via
snapshot) and we have to update the attachment without the manager, as
it is unaware that a temporary snapshot is being created.

Besides that main reason there are other less critical reasons to do the
attachment update in the driver:

- Smaller code change
- Easier to backport
- Limit change impact on other areas (better for backport)
- The snapshot_create model update code in the manager does not support
  updating attachments.
- There are cases in the cinder volume manager where the model update
  values returned by snapshot_create are not being applied.

Snapshot deletion belonging to in-use volumes are not affected by this
issue because we only do block commit when the snapshot file we are
deleting is not the active file.  In _delete_snapshot_online:

        if utils.paths_normcase_equal(info['active_file'],
                                      info['snapshot_file']):

Closes-Bug: #1860913
Change-Id: I62fcef3169dcb9f4363a5344af4b2711edfef632
(cherry picked from commit 25eb0a7d76922e3a1a289d26c36b96a91c4059db)
"}]
commit_message:
NFS: Update connection info on online snap create

The NFS snapshot creation for an attached volume requires interaction
between Nova and Cinder, and a new qcow2 file is used after the
attachment completes.

This means that the connection properties stored in the Attachment is no
longer valid, as it is pointing to the old qcow2 file, so if Nova tries
to use that attachment it will start writing on the old qcow2 file.

A flow showing this issue is:

- Attach NFS volume
- Create snapshot
- Hard reboot

After that the VM will start using the base image, breaking the qcow2
chain.

If we delete the snapshot in the meantime, then the VM will fail to
reboot.

This patch fixes this inconsistency by updating the connection info
field inside the remotefs driver.

We usually prefer that drivers don't to touch the DB, directly or
indirectly (using OVOs), but in this case we are using OVOs methods
instead of the usual model update on the volume manager because there
are cases in the driver where a snapshot is created (cloning via
snapshot) and we have to update the attachment without the manager, as
it is unaware that a temporary snapshot is being created.

Besides that main reason there are other less critical reasons to do the
attachment update in the driver:

- Smaller code change
- Easier to backport
- Limit change impact on other areas (better for backport)
- The snapshot_create model update code in the manager does not support
  updating attachments.
- There are cases in the cinder volume manager where the model update
  values returned by snapshot_create are not being applied.

Snapshot deletion belonging to in-use volumes are not affected by this
issue because we only do block commit when the snapshot file we are
deleting is not the active file.  In _delete_snapshot_online:

        if utils.paths_normcase_equal(info['active_file'],
                                      info['snapshot_file']):

Closes-Bug: #1860913
Change-Id: I62fcef3169dcb9f4363a5344af4b2711edfef632
(cherry picked from commit 25eb0a7d76922e3a1a289d26c36b96a91c4059db)

commit_message:
Gnocchi: replace deprecated [storage] coordination_url

[storage] coordination_url was deprecated since Gnocchi 4.1.0 and
replaced by [DEFAULT] coordination_url[1].

[1] https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/commit/70b9ca427

subject: Fix --stack-only to download ansible playbooks
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 16515, 'name': 'mbu', 'email': 'mat.bultel@gmail.com', 'username': 'matbu'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 30073, 'name': 'Brendan Shephard', 'email': 'bshephar@redhat.com', 'username': 'bshephar'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-06-29 19:20:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-06-30 01:49:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-06-30 10:37:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

AFAIK, we never used to download playbooks with --stack-only. That's the reason --setup-only was added, so that it can do the steps between stack update and running the playbooks (enable ssh and download config playbooks).

If stack-only is going do update the stack and download playbooks, we should just get rid of --setup-only"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-06-30 13:30:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I always used --stack-only to update stack and download playbooks (so does PSI and anyone running ansible by hand).'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-06-30 13:30:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

--setup-only assumes the stack has already been run. So it would have been a --stack-only followed by a --setup-only which is awkward. I'm uncertain why we changed this?"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-06-30 13:38:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> --setup-only assumes the stack has already been run. So it would have been a --stack-only followed by a --setup-only which is awkward. I'm uncertain why we changed this?


We did not change --stack-only. If --setup-only was supposed to everything other than running config-downloaded playbooks, then it should be changed back. I had the idea that --setup-only was added to do what is needed after you update the stack, so that the playbooks are available for someone to run them manually.

Too many options and we should get rid of some."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-06-30 13:44:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

--setup-only imports a db which doesn't exist on first run.  I'd ditch --setup-only unless there's some development workflow that this assists with?"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-06-30 13:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

btw the if condition here did change the functionality of --stack-only because it made the config fetching only happen if --setup-only is used.  This change switches it back to the previous functionality'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-07-06 20:48:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> btw the if condition here did change the functionality of --stack-only because it made the config fetching only happen if --setup-only is used.  This change switches it back to the previous functionality

this look ok to me.

i do think we need to revisit these options, especially in light of ephemeral heat. My thinking now is:

--stack-only: stack create only, and related stack artifacts saved: passwords, templates, overcloud export (not config-download export)

--setup-only: --stack-only plus config-download export and ssh enablement. we should not attempt to restore the db with ephemeral heat, we should just recreate the stack, it's meant to be ephemeral

--config-download-only: ansible execution of deploy_steps_playbook.yaml (if it doesn't exist, etc, we fail).

i think this would simplify it and make each option iterative of the previous, without the current jumping around that we have."}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-07-29 14:43:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2021-07-29 15:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-07-29 21:51:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-07-29 21:51:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]
