[{'created': '2021-06-29 19:20:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix --stack-only to download ansible playbooks

In previously versions, if you wanted to manually run the playbooks you
could use --stack-only to generate them and have them created for you.
This appears to be broken as the condition is now based on --setup-only
which attempts to restore a previously existing stack. This moves the
download config playbooks back to also being dependent on --stack-only
or --no-config-download

Change-Id: Ie810f9fbaabfff98595a3aaaf1878a348b17dfb4
Closes-Bug: #1934009
'}, {'created': '2021-07-29 21:51:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix --stack-only to download ansible playbooks

In previously versions, if you wanted to manually run the playbooks you
could use --stack-only to generate them and have them created for you.
This appears to be broken as the condition is now based on --setup-only
which attempts to restore a previously existing stack. This moves the
download config playbooks back to also being dependent on --stack-only
or --no-config-download

Change-Id: Ie810f9fbaabfff98595a3aaaf1878a348b17dfb4
Closes-Bug: #1934009
'}]
commit_message:
Fix --stack-only to download ansible playbooks

In previously versions, if you wanted to manually run the playbooks you
could use --stack-only to generate them and have them created for you.
This appears to be broken as the condition is now based on --setup-only
which attempts to restore a previously existing stack. This moves the
download config playbooks back to also being dependent on --stack-only
or --no-config-download

Change-Id: Ie810f9fbaabfff98595a3aaaf1878a348b17dfb4
Closes-Bug: #1934009

commit_message:
Partial revert of LM Optimization

In I1133c210f35181d44f8ba56f09b52f00589e035c we tried to automatically
enable come live-migration tweaks in certain conditions. We ended up
breaking live-migration in some rare cases. The last case was that
post-copy is not compatible with pinned instances as per related BZ.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1986567
Change-Id: I0849ed1ab4ac8aea24af12726127a8c68c2bd180

commit_message:
Stop launch fedora-32 nodes nodepool

A followup change will remove the diskimage configuration for fedora-32.
The current fedora releases are 33 and 34 so we should clean up 32.

commit_message:
Fix Inventory Generation without Overcloud deployed

The utils.list_plan_and_stack function returns None in case of exceptions
or and empty list if no stacks or no plans have been found in the
environment.

This patch fixes the conditional to allow the tripleo-ansible-inventory
script to generate only the undercloud Inventory when no Overcloud has
been deployed.

Related-bz: rhbz#1987318

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If0dc3300fbd8cf245c0477be782110d897344860

commit_message:
Moved all calls from _ENFORCER.authorize to a separate _authorize method

Created a new helper method and named it _authorize to use it to call
_ENFORCER.authorize.
This _authorize method catchs the FileNotFoundError and tries to
reinitiate the request.

Change-Id: Ia831053f88bbb5c8a4dab4daff9d75fd156e88ff
Closes-Bug: #1856119

subject: Fix extra_capabilities
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-29 20:01:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix extra_capabilities

This patch ensures that when pools are being reported that
the volume driver's configured extra_capabilities are inserted
into each pool reported by the driver.  Without this the
CapabilitiesFilter never sees the extra_capabilities.
This is also backwards compatible where drivers don't report pools,
the extra_capabilities are inserted correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1937086

Change-Id: I1f1830d8a7c0349861e9a74f92c9b9e04360a03b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix extra_capabilities

This patch ensures that when pools are being reported that
the volume driver's configured extra_capabilities are inserted
into each pool reported by the driver.  Without this the
CapabilitiesFilter never sees the extra_capabilities.
This is also backwards compatible where drivers don't report pools,
the extra_capabilities are inserted correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1937086

Change-Id: I1f1830d8a7c0349861e9a74f92c9b9e04360a03b

commit_message:
Fix the configuration issue

* Remove ApplyChanges and DiscardChanges actions
* Don't use cache when getting configuration
* Config parameter is added and removed one by one. There is no API
  to add or delete a specific parameter.

Story: 2009084
Task: 42901

Change-Id: I81e00c25c7569fb6b114e2f66b71552f2d093c0b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-04 11:16:07.000000000', 'message': "Convert hardware vlan to local vlan when packets from remote dvr router

Currently, when the network type is vlan the packets' vlan don't convert
to local vlan if the packets from remote dvr router. It will be OK if the
`firewall_driver` is `iptables`, But, if the `firewall_driver` is
`openvswitch`, these packets can't be resubmit to BASE_INGRESS(table 81).

Closes-Bug: #1831534
Change-Id: I22541d75e66fcbbae03d8493f2689e7d20d8a4b4
"}, {'created': '2019-06-04 11:31:30.000000000', 'message': "Convert hardware vlan to local vlan when packets from remote dvr router

Currently, when the network type is vlan, the packets' vlan don't convert
to local vlan if these packets from remote dvr router. It will be OK if the
`firewall_driver` is `iptables`, But, if the `firewall_driver` is
`openvswitch`, these packets can't be resubmit to BASE_INGRESS table(table 81),
because of the `dl_vlan` don't match correct flows in TRANSIENT_TABLE(table 60).

Closes-Bug: #1831534
Change-Id: I22541d75e66fcbbae03d8493f2689e7d20d8a4b4
"}, {'created': '2019-06-04 12:08:19.000000000', 'message': "Convert hardware vlan to local vlan when packets from remote dvr router

Currently, when the network type is vlan, the packets' vlan don't convert
to local vlan if these packets from remote dvr router. It will be OK if the
`firewall_driver` is `iptables`, But, if the `firewall_driver` is
`openvswitch`, these packets can't be resubmit to BASE_INGRESS table(table 81),
because of the `dl_vlan` don't match correct flows in TRANSIENT_TABLE(table 60).

Closes-Bug: #1831534
Change-Id: I22541d75e66fcbbae03d8493f2689e7d20d8a4b4
"}, {'created': '2019-06-04 16:28:03.000000000', 'message': "Convert hardware vlan to local vlan when packets from remote dvr router

Currently, when the network type is vlan, the packets' vlan don't convert
to local vlan if these packets from remote dvr router. It will be OK if the
`firewall_driver` is `iptables`, But, if the `firewall_driver` is
`openvswitch`, these packets can't be resubmit to BASE_INGRESS table(table 81),
because of the `dl_vlan` don't match correct flows in TRANSIENT_TABLE(table 60).

Closes-Bug: #1831534
Change-Id: I22541d75e66fcbbae03d8493f2689e7d20d8a4b4
"}, {'created': '2019-06-10 09:38:40.000000000', 'message': 'Improve flow tables about DVR in br-int

Currently, the flow tables only modify src MAC of patckets which
from remote qr-* port, this way will result in these packets mustn't
be processed by ovs flow `NORMAL` action. So, we must add some extra
flows to solve it.
For example:
  table=60, priority=4,dl_vlan=288,dl_dst=fa:16:3e:2d:d7:85 actions=strip_vlan,output:"tap0500d7e2-87"
  table=60, priority=4,dl_vlan=203,dl_dst=fa:16:3e:8f:88:bc actions=strip_vlan,output:"tap2610c99a-52"
and:
  table=82, priority=50,ct_state=+est-rel+rpl,ct_zone=644,ct_mark=0,reg5=0x1 actions=strip_vlan,output:1
  table=82, priority=50,ct_state=+est-rel+rpl,ct_zone=644,ct_mark=0,reg5=0x2 actions=strip_vlan,output:2

This patch modifies both `src MAC` and `in_port` of these packets,
and strip VLAN tag of these packets, by these processes these packets
will fully similar with packets that from local qr-*, we can securely
processed them wich `NORMAL` action. So that, we can simplify some flows
and fix some bugs.

Closes-Bug: #1831706
Closes-Bug: #1831534
Change-Id: I22541d75e66fcbbae03d8493f2689e7d20d8a4b4
'}, {'created': '2019-06-11 03:00:08.000000000', 'message': 'Modify `in_port` and `dl_vlan` fields of packets which from remote `qr-*` ports

This patch aim to make the packets which from remote `qr-*` ports
can be processed by `NORMAL` action.

Currently, the flow tables only modify `dl_src` field of patckets which
from remote qr-* port, this way will result in these packets mustn't
be processed by ovs flow `NORMAL` action(The reason is explained in
bug/1831706). So, we must add some extra flows to solve it.
For example (These flows will be deleted in this patch.):
  table=60, priority=4,dl_vlan=288,dl_dst=fa:16:3e:2d:d7:85 actions=strip_vlan,output:"tap0500d7e2-87"
  table=60, priority=4,dl_vlan=203,dl_dst=fa:16:3e:8f:88:bc actions=strip_vlan,output:"tap2610c99a-52"
and (These flows will be improved in patch[1]):
  table=82, priority=50,ct_state=+est-rel+rpl,ct_zone=644,ct_mark=0,reg5=0x1 actions=strip_vlan,output:1
  table=82, priority=50,ct_state=+est-rel+rpl,ct_zone=644,ct_mark=0,reg5=0x2 actions=strip_vlan,output:2

This patch modifies both `dl_src` and `in_port` of these packets,
and strip VLAN tag of these packets, by these processes these packets
will fully similar with packets that from local qr-*, we can securely
processed them wich `NORMAL` action. So that, we can simplify some flows
and fix some bugs(bug/1831534).

This patch aim to make the packets which from remote `qr-*` ports
can be processed by `NORMAL` action.

Currently, the flow tables only modify `dl_src` field of patckets which
from remote qr-* port, this way will result in these packets mustn't
be processed by ovs flow `NORMAL` action(The reason is explained in
bug 1831706). So, in order to avoid `NORMAL` action we need below flows(I
think we can simplify them).
For example:
(These flows will be removed in this patch.):
  table=60, priority=4,dl_vlan=288,dl_dst=fa:16:3e:2d:d7:85 actions=strip_vlan,output:"tap0500d7e2-87"
  table=60, priority=4,dl_vlan=203,dl_dst=fa:16:3e:8f:88:bc actions=strip_vlan,output:"tap2610c99a-52"
and (These flows will be improved in patch[1]):

  table=81, priority=100,arp,reg5=0x2 actions=strip_vlan,output:2
  table=81, priority=100,icmp6,reg5=0x1,icmp_type=130 actions=strip_vlan,output:1
  table=81, priority=100,icmp6,reg5=0x2,icmp_type=130 actions=strip_vlan,output:2
  table=82, priority=50,ct_state=+est-rel+rpl,ct_zone=644,ct_mark=0,reg5=0x1 actions=strip_vlan,output:1
  table=82, priority=50,ct_state=+est-rel+rpl,ct_zone=644,ct_mark=0,reg5=0x2 actions=strip_vlan,output:2

strip VLAN tag of these packets. Through these modifications, we can
make the packets coming from the remote qr-* port and the packets coming
from local qr-* port fully similar. This will make we can process them
with `NORMAL` action securely.

Other more things, this patch fixed the bug 1831534 and resolved the
breaking issue of DVR east/west traffic in patch[1]. Further on, I want
to simplify some flows about openvswitch firewall driver[2], the patch[2]
depends on patch[1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/639009/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/665647/

commit_message:
Modify `in_port` and `dl_vlan` fields of packets coming from remote `qr-*` ports

This patch aims to make the packets coming in from remote `qr-*` ports
can be processed by `NORMAL` action.

Currently, the flow tables only modify `dl_src` field of packets
which come from remote qr-* port, as a result of this, these packets
mustn't be processed by ovs flow `NORMAL` action(The reason is
explained in bug 1831706). So, in order to avoid `NORMAL` action we
need the flows below(I think we can simplify them).
For example:
  (These flows will be removed in this patch, they result in bug 1831534.)
  table=60, priority=4,dl_vlan=288,dl_dst=fa:16:3e:2d:d7:85 actions=strip_vlan,output:"tap0500d7e2-87"
  table=60, priority=4,dl_vlan=203,dl_dst=fa:16:3e:8f:88:bc actions=strip_vlan,output:"tap2610c99a-52"
and:
  (These flows will be improved in patch[1]):
  table=81, priority=100,arp,reg5=0x1 actions=strip_vlan,output:1
  table=81, priority=100,arp,reg5=0x2 actions=strip_vlan,output:2
  table=81, priority=100,icmp6,reg5=0x1,icmp_type=130 actions=strip_vlan,output:1
  table=81, priority=100,icmp6,reg5=0x2,icmp_type=130 actions=strip_vlan,output:2
  table=82, priority=50,ct_state=+est-rel+rpl,ct_zone=644,ct_mark=0,reg5=0x1 actions=strip_vlan,output:1
  table=82, priority=50,ct_state=+est-rel+rpl,ct_zone=644,ct_mark=0,reg5=0x2 actions=strip_vlan,output:2

This patch modifies both `dl_src` and `in_port` of packets which come
from remote qr-* port, and strip VLAN tag of these packets. Through
these modifications, we can make the packets coming from the remote
qr-* port and the packets coming from local qr-* port fully similar.
This change will make sure that we can process them with `NORMAL` action
securely. So, base on this patch the breaking issue of DVR east/west
traffic in patch[1] will be resolved.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/639009/

Closes-Bug: #1831706
Closes-Bug: #1831534
Change-Id: I22541d75e66fcbbae03d8493f2689e7d20d8a4b4

The tox option to skip source distribution building is skipsdist,
but this seems to be often misspelled skipdist instead, which gets
silently ignored and so does not take effect. Correct it
everywhere, in hopes that new projects will finally stop copying

'}]
commit_message:
Correct the tox option for skipping sdist generation

The tox option to skip source distribution building is skipsdist,
but this seems to be often misspelled skipdist instead, which gets
silently ignored and so does not take effect. Correct it
everywhere, in hopes that new projects will finally stop copying
this mistake around.

See https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-skipsdist
and https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/1388 for details.

Change-Id: I639066169913072b992c0e1073f9398d6ac8cdd2

commit_message:
Refactor iDRAC OEM extension manager calls

- Re-usable helper created to avoid duplication.
- Although there is only one manager for system in known iDRAC systems
still iterate through collection for future changes.
- Restructured exception raising and error logging for better feedback.
- Removed some unit tests to avoid duplication that is covered by
method specific unit tests

(cherry picked from commit 39cd751a9063ae04e1649ccbca5496c3754d706e)

Conflicts:
	ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/drac/test_boot.py

Change-Id: I03fdb48e47c9557c207a20ee876eccf3f3459d9f

subject: Add Infoblox support
messages:
[{'account_id': 31255, 'date': '2020-11-10 15:06:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-07-29 22:29:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Apologies for the extremely late review here. This should be implemented as a subordinate charm and new relation to be implemented rather than mapping it into the designate charm. The subordinate charm would have the necessary config options for Infoblox which would need to be passed over a (new) relation to the designate charm, where the designate principal charm (this charm) would then render the provided configuration information.

For contributing new charms, this would need a spec to help everyone understand and agree on the details of the implementation and the solution it aims to cover.

There's some documentation in the charm-guide [0] to help you get started. The "New Manila Plugin Configuration Charm" can be used as a rough guide for what would be necessary and how to go about this. Also feel free to reach out in #openstack-charms on oftc IRC network if you have additional questions.

[0] - https://docs.openstack.org/charm-guide/latest/creating-charms.html'}]

When the name or description of port was set to Chinese character,
dhcp agent will unable to sync network state and it's possible that

Change-Id: I664681dfe5b2f9a12dfdd665b70f00658171fae1
"}]
commit_message:
Repair the problem that Chinese character lead to dhcp agent exception

When the name or description of port was set to Chinese character,
dhcp agent will unable to sync network state and it's possible that
vms can't get the IP address under the circumstances.

Change-Id: I664681dfe5b2f9a12dfdd665b70f00658171fae1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-30 13:24:43.000000000', 'message': 'Replace md5 with oslo version

md5 is not an approved algorithm in FIPS mode, and trying to
instantiate a hashlib.md5() will fail when the system is running in
FIPS mode.

md5 is allowed when in a non-security context.  There is a plan to
add a keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) to hashlib.md5() to annotate
whether or not the instance is being used in a security context.

In the case where it is not, the instantiation of md5 will be allowed.
See https://bugs.python.org/issue9216 for more details.

Some downstream python versions already support this parameter.  To
support these versions, a new encapsulation of md5() has been added to
oslo_utils.  See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750031/

This patch is to replace the instances of hashlib.md5() with this new
encapsulation, adding an annotation indicating whether the usage is
a security context or not.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/760160
Change-Id: I8020ed9299b4dd39f943ce4768bcea44ef64c0e6

commit_message:
Replace md5 with oslo version

md5 is not an approved algorithm in FIPS mode, and trying to
instantiate a hashlib.md5() will fail when the system is running in
FIPS mode.

md5 is allowed when in a non-security context.  There is a plan to
add a keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) to hashlib.md5() to annotate
whether or not the instance is being used in a security context.

In the case where it is not, the instantiation of md5 will be allowed.
See https://bugs.python.org/issue9216 for more details.

Some downstream python versions already support this parameter.  To
support these versions, a new encapsulation of md5() has been added to
oslo_utils.  See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750031/

This patch is to replace the instances of hashlib.md5() with this new
encapsulation, adding an annotation indicating whether the usage is
a security context or not.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/760160
Change-Id: I8020ed9299b4dd39f943ce4768bcea44ef64c0e6

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-25 13:15:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add traffic_requests configuration option

The test coverage matrix has recently exploded from a few dozens of
tests to hundreds. Many of the tests send up to 20 traffic requests to
members and load balancers to check consistency of responses. The number
of requests is not tunable (harcoded), and now with hundreds of tests
takes CI jobs a very long time to run the full test suite.

This patch adds a new configuration option to allow tunning the number
of traffic requests to members and load balancer VIPs. The default
number is 4.

Change-Id: I2fd55d0328e567e03a43a1bc8581e47a76f4cd07
'}]
commit_message:
Add traffic_requests configuration option

The test coverage matrix has recently exploded from a few dozens of
tests to hundreds. Many of the tests send up to 20 traffic requests to
members and load balancers to check consistency of responses. The number
of requests is not tunable (harcoded), and now with hundreds of tests
takes CI jobs a very long time to run the full test suite.

This patch adds a new configuration option to allow tunning the number
of traffic requests to members and load balancer VIPs. The default
number is 4.

Change-Id: I2fd55d0328e567e03a43a1bc8581e47a76f4cd07

messages:
[{'account_id': 31414, 'date': '2020-03-04 16:32:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-03-04 16:33:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 31414, 'date': '2020-03-04 16:37:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-03-04 18:56:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm not sure I understand what this is for. The stats show command already lists all of the available statistics for load balancers and listeners.
https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/index.html?expanded=get-load-balancer-statistics-detail#get-load-balancer-statistics"}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-03-04 19:05:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Yeah, I don't know where these additional stats would come from. We don't have additional stats in our DB nor do we collect them from the Amphorae.
Is there any chance this is for a third-party provider's stats, and not the ones we provide with the Amphora provider?"}, {'account_id': 31414, 'date': '2020-03-04 19:06:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-03-04 19:09:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

But even the third party stats came from the neutron/octavia DB. They were never direct to a driver.
This was to allow for aggregate stats API calls.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-03-04 19:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

How are you getting additional stats fields to display? Our API/DB only shows the fields we already configured. Is this for a 3rd-party provider, or possibly to go along with a patch to the Octavia API to add more stats fields?'}, {'account_id': 31414, 'date': '2020-03-04 19:17:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> How are you getting additional stats fields to display? Our API/DB
 > only shows the fields we already configured. Is this for a
 > 3rd-party provider, or possibly to go along with a patch to the
 > Octavia API to add more stats fields?

We are using octavia osc with the neutron-lbaas. The request never goes through Octavia API. Apologies for the confusion, i should've mentioned this before."}, {'account_id': 31414, 'date': '2020-03-04 19:19:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

We are using octavia osc with the neutron-lbaas. The request never goes through Octavia API. Apologies for the confusion, i should've mentioned this before."}, {'account_id': 7160, 'date': '2020-06-19 16:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-07-29 22:23:50.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Brian Haley.'}]

commit_message:
[OVN] Remove DNS dependency on original port dict

The 'port_object' needs to be removed, so the current DNS dependency
on it needs to be resolved first. The 'dns_domain' is stored in the
'external_ids' of the logical switch. The 'dns_name' and 'dns_assignment'
are stored in the 'external_ids' of the logical switch port.

Change-Id: If08909dfbb841ad941e6aaea0990e9e98354e3d9
Partial-Bug: #1863987

[{'created': '2020-04-27 22:17:35.000000000', 'message': 'Share the LB security group with the LB owner

This will allow the owner of the LB to add that LB's security group to
their members' security groups as a trusted remote group. This closes
the security hole that exists presently, where members must trust the
full range of IPs in the member's subnet (which is bad for provider
networks).

Currently WIP because Neutron only supports the "access_as_shared"
action for SG sharing, which grants read AND write access to the SG.
I will be proposing "access_as_readonly" as a second action for SGs.

commit_message:
Share the LB security group with the LB owner

This will allow the owner of the LB to add that LB's security group to
their members' security groups as a trusted remote group. This closes
the security hole that exists presently, where members must trust the
full range of IPs in the member's subnet (which is bad for provider
networks).

Currently WIP because Neutron only supports the "access_as_shared"
action for SG sharing, which grants read AND write access to the SG.
I will be proposing "access_as_readonly" as a second action for SGs.
See: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/724207/

Change-Id: I38300ce34cd1838c21a1bb8b620929bcc6711db9

commit_message:
Remove old api_v1_enabled cruft from job defs

APIv1 no longer exists, this option is simply outdated and misleading.
Move this config to specific stable jobs, so when they are removed,
these references will go along with them.

Change-Id: I3bae22943a74978de72e6fdfff40ad80e46ab4f1

commit_message:
Sync deleted SmartNIC ports on Neutron OVS agent restart

On Neutron OVS agent resync, remove the ports that was deleted
from the server and yet present in OVS db.

Change-Id: If166560193c73bf674537ef076f2f38847fbf2c5
Partial-Bug: #1855260

commit_message:
Add George framework and tests

This patch adds the main parts of the George framework. There is a still
lot of work ahead that will come in other patches. The main parts are:

 - Documentation
 - more tests that will ensure George can run in parallel
 - use fullstack tests in George

At this point, the job is added to the Experimental queue, even though
I'm confident the framework is stable, I don't see a value in running it
in the check queue yet, until we cover more scenarios.

Related-bug: #1863113

Co-Authored-By: Rodolfo Alonso Hernandez <ralonsoh@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I2b06dfc7ec586d25aa3ad2cd4be45dc32f44b5ec

commit_message:
Also handle network deltas when deleting members

the original code only handles network when add members,
this may result in some issues as I described in the below story.
this patch adds codes to support remove its network interfaces
in the amphora namespace while deleting members

Change-Id: I9348cfc8e87351d94c225f07533b7676dcbe50e3
Story: #2007762

subject: Add support for building arm64 images
messages:
[{'account_id': 9649, 'date': '2021-01-15 14:03:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9649, 'date': '2021-01-15 14:05:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2021-01-15 14:05:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the patch!
Please note there is already on going efforts in Octavia to support ARM64-based deployments. See https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22octavia-arm64%22'}, {'account_id': 9649, 'date': '2021-01-15 14:10:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

If you are referring to this patch https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/octavia/+/738096, I see it s been open for a while but not yet merged as it has too broader scope (devstack + diskimage create). I can change this one to the minimum necessary so that we can merge it faster?'}, {'account_id': 9649, 'date': '2021-01-15 14:14:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2021-01-15 14:15:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes, I'm referring to that patch. The patch covers diskimage create tool just like this patch of yours as well as devstack as you correctly mentioned. The reason for such is because we want to make sure we merge functional code tested in upstream CI and that led to another patch -- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin/+/747629"}, {'account_id': 9649, 'date': '2021-01-15 14:21:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> Yes, I'm referring to that patch. The patch covers diskimage create tool just like this patch of yours as well as devstack as you correctly mentioned. The reason for such is because we want to make sure we merge functional code tested in upstream CI and that led to another patch -- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin/+/747629

I suggest to not use aarch64, and use arm64, as it can be reused for Ubuntu images too. Also, if you use arm64, there is no need to change the package installs file.

And dividing the patches in smaller atomic ones can lead to a faster merge.

Thank you."}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2021-01-20 16:52:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Backport-Candidate+1 Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9649, 'date': '2021-02-18 12:47:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9649, 'date': '2021-02-18 12:48:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9649, 'date': '2021-02-24 16:10:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hello Marcin,

would be great if you could take a look at this patch.

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2021-02-24 18:02:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Check does it builds CentOS and Ubuntu images.

Debian based systems use 'arm64' as architecture name while Fedora based ones use 'aarch64'."}, {'account_id': 9649, 'date': '2021-02-24 18:40:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-07-29 22:20:51.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Brian Haley.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-15 14:03:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for building arm64 images

Diskimage-builder does not support armhf architecture for building
CentOS images, as it cannot download the base image because the
base image URL is constructed using the architecture value.

Change-Id: Ie2c1bacc920d4d8639d1ceb7251ab5af1ecd26f2
'}, {'created': '2021-01-15 14:05:28.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for building CentOS arm64 images

Diskimage-builder does not support armhf architecture for building
CentOS images, as it cannot download the base image because the
base image URL is constructed using the architecture value mapping to
aarch64 and the existent armhf is not mapped to aarch64.

Change-Id: Ie2c1bacc920d4d8639d1ceb7251ab5af1ecd26f2
'}, {'created': '2021-01-15 14:14:36.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for building CentOS arm64 images

Diskimage-builder does not support armhf architecture for building
CentOS images, as it cannot download the base image because the
base image URL is constructed using the architecture value mapping to
aarch64 and the existent armhf is not mapped to aarch64.

Change-Id: Ie2c1bacc920d4d8639d1ceb7251ab5af1ecd26f2
'}, {'created': '2021-02-18 12:47:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for building arm64 images

Added option for the architecture (-a) flag so that ARM64 images
can be built.

Change-Id: Ie2c1bacc920d4d8639d1ceb7251ab5af1ecd26f2
'}, {'created': '2021-02-18 12:48:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for building arm64 images

Added option `arm64` for the architecture (-a) flag so that ARM64
images can be built.

commit_message:
Add support for building arm64 images

Added option `arm64` for the architecture (-a) flag so that ARM64
images can be built.

Change-Id: Ie2c1bacc920d4d8639d1ceb7251ab5af1ecd26f2

commit_message:
Add certificate update tests for TLS scenarios

This patch adds 3 certificate update tests:
        test_update_certificate_tls_traffic
        test_update_certificate_mixed_http_https
        test_update_SNI_certificate_test

Which update certificates for these tests:
        test_basic_tls_traffic
        test_mixed_http_https_traffic
        test_basic_tls_SNI_traffic

Change-Id: I643ea5c9debad08df6c6734cfc7decbbbec608a6

subject: Don't fail if a provider driver cannot be loaded in Octavia API
messages:
[{'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2021-03-12 10:14:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2021-03-12 10:57:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm not sure the API service should silently (without paying attention to the logs) continue without the missing/invalid/faulty provider driver or just exit with error. The provider driver will show up in a provider list GET call which could mislead admins/users to believe it is correctly configured and available.

Related story: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2007412"}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2021-03-22 23:46:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-07-29 22:20:20.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Brian Haley.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-12 10:14:21.000000000', 'message': "Don't fail if a provider driver cannot be loaded in Octavia API

Fix an issue that prevents the Octavia API service to be correctly
initialized when it fails to load a provider driver.

When enabled_provider_drivers setting is not correctly configured (ex:
if it contains a non existing driver) or when a provider driver fails
to load, the exception was not caught by the Octavia API service, so the
service was not properly configured and the whole Octavia API was
unreachable.

Now the Octavia API service skips the driver initialization in case of
errors, and the other provider drivers are functional.

Story 2008710
Task 42044

Change-Id: I34341e1aaad1524e3e0834309c5f6897f176af53
"}]
commit_message:
Don't fail if a provider driver cannot be loaded in Octavia API

Fix an issue that prevents the Octavia API service to be correctly
initialized when it fails to load a provider driver.

When enabled_provider_drivers setting is not correctly configured (ex:
if it contains a non existing driver) or when a provider driver fails
to load, the exception was not caught by the Octavia API service, so the
service was not properly configured and the whole Octavia API was
unreachable.

Now the Octavia API service skips the driver initialization in case of
errors, and the other provider drivers are functional.

Story 2008710
Task 42044

Change-Id: I34341e1aaad1524e3e0834309c5f6897f176af53

commit_message:
Remove legacy CI jobs

These CI jobs were used in stable/queens and stable/rocky branches.
Since Octavia Queens and Rocky are EOL, we can remove them.

Change-Id: I35cc36ab7f01c1f5a99d8cd8a94c41cecea3b7b7

commit_message:
Add Octavia performance guide and 2vcpu flavor

This patch adds a performance tuning guide to the Octavia
Administrative documentation and adds an Octavia flavor for two
vCPU amphora as an example.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin/+/787449
Change-Id: Ia51f97fc5c0e67072a50ea5ee57673112e8a39a9

(1 comment)

Note: To trigger this, the user must already have authorization to make changes to the load balancer. The scope of the issue is limited to the user running arbitrary code on their own load balancer instance.

Also, in the future, please help us by following the OpenStack security issue process here:
https://security.openstack.org/vmt-process.html

That said, I think it would be better to enhance the existing validation for this field here:
https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/src/branch/master/octavia/common/validate.py#L52'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2021-06-21 20:34:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We are going to want a functional test and release note for this as well.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-07-29 22:15:27.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Brian Haley.'}]

commit_message:
fix(common): normalize url before render haproxy config

Fix Remote Code Execution in HAProxy Amphora Agent that based on
config injection throughout url_path attribute in HealthMonitor or
redirect_url / redirect_prefix attributes in L7Policy.

Task: 42656
Story: 2008994

Change-Id: Ib062c53ce2438485f3252bd6e1cf7db197b8a4cd
Signed-off-by: Mikhail Ushanov <gm.mephisto@gmail.com>

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

[{'created': '2020-04-28 10:45:04.000000000', 'message': 'Altinative Distributor for L3 Active-Active,
N+1 Amphora Setup

Octavia need to support active-active feature. The community has
previously had a scheme for implementing active-active feature using L3
distributors. This solution uses the BGP/ECMP approach. We would like
to provide an alternative solution that utilizes the L3 network to
implement this feature.
This solution is architecturally simple, however, it requires Neutron
support.

commit_message:
Alternative Distributor for L3 Active-Active, N+1 Amphora Setup

Octavia need to support active-active feature. The community has
previously had a scheme for implementing active-active feature using L3
distributors. This solution uses the BGP/ECMP approach. We would like
to provide an alternative solution that utilizes the L3 network to
implement this feature.
This solution is architecturally simple, however, it requires Neutron
support.

Implementation: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/746688/

Change-Id: Ie29137f2a22467f110725b790debfd2a6448ebc8
Story: 2007602
Task: 39585

commit_message:
Updating _test_pool_CRUD to enable testing of updates to the
load balancer algorithm:

Added a new parameter "next_algorithm" that defaults to None.
If next_algorithm is not None then the update of the pool
will also update the pool's loadbalancing algorithm.
Previous tests without this parameter ARE NOT AFFECTED.

New Test:
test_UDP_SIP_to_LC_pool_with_listener_CRUD
tests the result of updating the pool's
loadbalancing algorithm
fix-now

Change-Id: Ia2f62ce38d96b72f2b9d81b555708564fdf90550

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-03 11:05:55.000000000', 'message': 'Add VRRP failover test

The aim of the test is to validate that in case master VM becomes not
available the traffic to the VIP is directed to the second VM.
Such scenario is often used for example in environments with Octavia
load balancers.

Scenario:
- Create a port for VRRP VIP and ports for VMs with
  allowed address pair configured to the VIP IP
- Create two VMs on different compute nodes
- Setup VRRP between the VMs
- Test traffic to virtual IP (login via ssh)
- Shut off active VM
- Test traffic to virtual IP. Traffic should now flow to the second VM

Change-Id: I0dce852066b3931300a1fbd095c69e64c872fcf8

commit_message:
Add VRRP failover test

The aim of the test is to validate that in case master VM becomes not
available the traffic to the VIP is directed to the second VM.
Such scenario is often used for example in environments with Octavia
load balancers.

Scenario:
- Create a port for VRRP VIP and ports for VMs with
  allowed address pair configured to the VIP IP
- Create two VMs and setup VRRP between the VMs
- Test traffic to virtual IP (login via ssh)
- Shut off active VM
- Test traffic to virtual IP. Traffic should now flow to the second VM

Change-Id: I0dce852066b3931300a1fbd095c69e64c872fcf8

Change-Id: I5da43dc244c1a4fa828a00c02e3aa5b5f1b71e14
"}, {'created': '2021-07-06 02:58:39.000000000', 'message': "Defer checking image size until instance info is built

The image size check is skipped if the image is raw and will be
streamed directly to disk. However metalsmith does not expose
instance_info so it is not possible to set image_disk_format=raw.

image_disk_format is detected and set during
build_instance_info_for_deploy but this is run *after* the call to
check_image_size. This results in large raw whole-disk images always

image_disk_format isn't explicitly set).

validate to after the call to build_instance_info_for_deploy.

Blueprint: whole-disk-default
Change-Id: I5da43dc244c1a4fa828a00c02e3aa5b5f1b71e14
"}]
commit_message:
Defer checking image size until instance info is built

The image size check is skipped if the image is raw and will be
streamed directly to disk. However metalsmith does not expose
instance_info so it is not possible to set image_disk_format=raw.

image_disk_format is detected and set during
build_instance_info_for_deploy but this is run *after* the call to
check_image_size. This results in large raw whole-disk images always
failing check_image_size when deployed by metalsmith (or any time
image_disk_format isn't explicitly set).

This change avoids that by moving the check_image_size call out of
validate to after the call to build_instance_info_for_deploy.

Blueprint: whole-disk-default
Change-Id: I5da43dc244c1a4fa828a00c02e3aa5b5f1b71e14

mode is enabled.  To speed up testing, the other check jobs have

commit_message:
Add member API tests that do not pass subnet ID

Since the subnet ID is an optional argument for member
operations, create a new sub-class MemberAPITestNoSubnetID
that omits it from all the member API calls.

Change-Id: I7615f03dc363e73a045b5a913020ad045eaa8b70

subject: Always pass subnet ID to member_create()
messages:
[{'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-07-23 19:32:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-07-23 19:32:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-07-24 02:17:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't see these tests failing any more for the ovn provider, https://review.opendev.org/#/c/742730/"}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-08-20 19:13:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-08-25 21:29:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

This is intentional in these tests. The member subnet ID is optional per the API [1] and should be tested when one is not provided.
Members with no subnet are considered to be on the VIP subnet, making the load balancer a one-armed load balancer.
I would recommend updating the OVN provider to copy in the VIP subnet ID if it requires it as other drivers do not.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/index.html?expanded=create-member-detail#create-member'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-08-26 19:16:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Michael - I didn't see anywhere in these tests where they were explicitly not passing the subnet id, and in _test_member_create() the subnet id is passed, so not doing it in the delete and list tests, but doing it in show, update and batch_update seems like it was missed.

I understand it's not mandatory, but every test should be consistent.  I'll look at the driver, but I remember Maciej saying it wasn't trivial to fix it there."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-08-27 18:15:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-10-06 15:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-10-06 16:17:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-10-06 16:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Just rebased'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-10-22 14:12:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-06-23 19:18:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-07-29 21:03:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No time to work on this, reopen if needed.'}]

commit_message:
Always pass subnet ID to member_create()

There are two test scenarios that are not passing a subnet ID
to member_create() - test_member_delete() and test_member_list().
The OVN provider driver requires the subnet ID, so change them
to pass it since it is present, and since all the other tests
in the class already do.

Fixed a test member name as well to match it's arguments.

A follow-on patch will run all these tests without any subnet ID
since it is an optional argument.

Change-Id: I1d9311e0b4e07920002b2f4e25812a3c536029a2
Story: 2007954
Task: 40433

commit_message:
Add meta/runtime.yml file required by galaxy

Ansible Galaxy added[1][2] a mandatory requirement for meta/runtime.yml
file and requires_ansible field in it. Add it to allow uploading
to Galaxy.

[2] https://github.com/ansible/galaxy-importer/pull/124

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-13 20:14:26.000000000', 'message': "Limit tripleo-repos to CentOS

Our example playbooks have tripleo_repos defined however if they are run
on RHEL boxes this fails. Let's limit the tripleo_repos to just centos
for now.  Additionally switch to use ansible_facts for distribution
version information as well.

Change-Id: Ib9dc4219254b1afc9eb6b4e35099b1b3649930a7

commit_message:
Limit tripleo-repos to CentOS

Our example playbooks have tripleo_repos defined however if they are run
on RHEL boxes this fails. Let's limit the tripleo_repos to just centos
for now.  Additionally switch to use ansible_facts for distribution
version information as well.

Change-Id: Ib9dc4219254b1afc9eb6b4e35099b1b3649930a7

commit_message:
Refactor iDRAC OEM extension manager calls

- Re-usable helper created to avoid duplication.
- Although there is only one manager for system in known iDRAC systems
still iterate through collection for future changes.
- Restructured exception raising and error logging for better feedback.
- Removed some unit tests to avoid duplication that is covered by
method specific unit tests

Change-Id: I03fdb48e47c9557c207a20ee876eccf3f3459d9f
(cherry picked from commit 39cd751a9063ae04e1649ccbca5496c3754d706e)

[{'created': '2021-06-30 02:57:00.000000000', 'message': 'Notify ROUTER_GATEWAY event for router gw mode

Router gateway mode extension updating should notify the event
of ROUTER_GATEWAY, otherwise the event cannot be handled accurately.
Using ROUTER event, the event receiver will add a lot of check
conditions to confirm whether the GW has changed or the other
properties of router have changed.

Trivial fix.

Change-Id: I4dd35c9f0b0527e1a972cbade4388ffa6699930d
'}]
commit_message:
Notify ROUTER_GATEWAY event for router gw mode

Router gateway mode extension updating should notify the event
of ROUTER_GATEWAY, otherwise the event cannot be handled accurately.
Using ROUTER event, the event receiver will add a lot of check
conditions to confirm whether the GW has changed or the other
properties of router have changed.

Trivial fix.

Change-Id: I4dd35c9f0b0527e1a972cbade4388ffa6699930d

subject: Copy generated /boot/grub2/grubenv to EFI dirs
messages: [{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-07-28 20:53:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-07-29 14:36:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-28 20:53:19.000000000', 'message': 'Copy generated /boot/grub2/grubenv to EFI dirs

There is an issue with grub2 in rhel-8.2 where generating grub.cfg in
an EFI directory will regenerate grubenv in /boot/grub2. Then when the
host is rebooted, the stale grubenv file in the EFI directory is used,
and any new kernal args are not used.

This change works around this by copying /boot/grub2/grubenv to the
EFI directories. Newer versions of grub2 many not show this behaviour
but the workaround can remain in place.

This change also adds /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT to the list of EFI
directories checked for, as it should have been in the original list.

See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1974507

Change-Id: I4f8664c9033502b25b40646cfd8976cc5638e643
(cherry picked from commit c1d4d602f8d2a3a1010735de10883c5047ad83ca)
'}]
commit_message:
Copy generated /boot/grub2/grubenv to EFI dirs

There is an issue with grub2 in rhel-8.2 where generating grub.cfg in
an EFI directory will regenerate grubenv in /boot/grub2. Then when the
host is rebooted, the stale grubenv file in the EFI directory is used,
and any new kernal args are not used.

This change works around this by copying /boot/grub2/grubenv to the
EFI directories. Newer versions of grub2 many not show this behaviour
but the workaround can remain in place.

This change also adds /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT to the list of EFI
directories checked for, as it should have been in the original list.

See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1974507

Change-Id: I4f8664c9033502b25b40646cfd8976cc5638e643
(cherry picked from commit c1d4d602f8d2a3a1010735de10883c5047ad83ca)

commit_message:
Extend has_version function to accept version parameter

We might need not only to check whether the service is supported, but
also whether specific version of the service is working.
Extend functional tests of the block-storage to actually check specific
version.

Change-Id: Ie71c4f818d5adc82466e06d994c258af271b5793
(cherry picked from commit 0bc47cdb933e12fd142747371720e8a1f74cb795)

commit_message:
Copy generated /boot/grub2/grubenv to EFI dirs

There is an issue with grub2 in rhel-8.2 where generating grub.cfg in
an EFI directory will regenerate grubenv in /boot/grub2. Then when the
host is rebooted, the stale grubenv file in the EFI directory is used,
and any new kernal args are not used.

This change works around this by copying /boot/grub2/grubenv to the
EFI directories. Newer versions of grub2 many not show this behaviour
but the workaround can remain in place.

This change also adds /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT to the list of EFI
directories checked for, as it should have been in the original list.

See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1974507

Change-Id: I4f8664c9033502b25b40646cfd8976cc5638e643
(cherry picked from commit c1d4d602f8d2a3a1010735de10883c5047ad83ca)

commit_message:
Enable ovn-monitor-all option to ovn-controller

With conditional monitoring enabled in OVN, southbound ovsdb-serve
takes lot of time in handling the monitoring and sending the updates
to all its connected clients. Its takes lot of CPU. With monitor-all
option, all ovn-controllers do not enable conditional monitoring there
by reducing the load on the Southbound ovsdb-server.
Enable this for all deployments is-lowrisk and user shoudn't have
posibilities to modified this manually form tht level.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-ovn/+/801455
Closes-Bug: #1936781
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I9014ad0c7fae391dec4ad70bcbc0728667d413c5

commit_message:
Copy generated /boot/grub2/grubenv to EFI dirs

There is an issue with grub2 in rhel-8.2 where generating grub.cfg in
an EFI directory will regenerate grubenv in /boot/grub2. Then when the
host is rebooted, the stale grubenv file in the EFI directory is used,
and any new kernal args are not used.

This change works around this by copying /boot/grub2/grubenv to the
EFI directories. Newer versions of grub2 many not show this behaviour
but the workaround can remain in place.

This change also adds /boot/efi/EFI/BOOT to the list of EFI
directories checked for, as it should have been in the original list.

See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1974507

Change-Id: I4f8664c9033502b25b40646cfd8976cc5638e643
(cherry picked from commit c1d4d602f8d2a3a1010735de10883c5047ad83ca)

commit_message:
Add CephAdmDebug parameter

This change adds the cephadm debug parameter to allow operators to
set the debug related config-key and see a more verbose output.

Depends-On: Ic2e54e537b50cb92b1650e78f1af61703e877763
Change-Id: I9c3a38b828404b559ca4858e1d4e1297aa668301

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-26 06:13:15.000000000', 'message': 'Octavia: Remove redundant cleanup of tls_proxy

The octavia_tls_proxy container was removed during the Rocky cycle by
commit f4460a580d24a709a4b2dede807b57fa9ab24f2b .

The octavia_tls_proxy container might be deployed in an old Queens
deployment but the container should be deleted when the deployment is
updated/upgraded to one of
 - Latest Queens
 - Rocky
 - Train
so the cleanup step is no longer required in Ussuri and later.

Change-Id: I91f23f8508201d2489650d1121019b7e71ccc768
'}, {'created': '2021-06-26 06:23:51.000000000', 'message': 'Octavia: Remove unused cleanup tasks of tls_proxy container

The octavia_tls_proxy container was removed during the Rocky cycle by
commit f4460a580d24a709a4b2dede807b57fa9ab24f2b .

The octavia_tls_proxy container might be deployed in an old Queens
deployment but the container should be deleted when the deployment is
updated/upgraded to one of
 - Latest Queens (before to Train)
 - Rocky
so the cleanup step is no longer required in Stein and later.

Closes-Bug: #1933712
Change-Id: I91f23f8508201d2489650d1121019b7e71ccc768
'}]
commit_message:
Octavia: Remove unused cleanup tasks of tls_proxy container

The octavia_tls_proxy container was removed during the Rocky cycle by
commit f4460a580d24a709a4b2dede807b57fa9ab24f2b .

The octavia_tls_proxy container might be deployed in an old Queens
deployment but the container should be deleted when the deployment is
updated/upgraded to one of
 - Latest Queens (before to Train)
 - Rocky
so the cleanup step is no longer required in Stein and later.

Closes-Bug: #1933712
Change-Id: I91f23f8508201d2489650d1121019b7e71ccc768

commit_message:
Update default var for undercloud_enable_novajoin

Updating default var for "undercloud_enable_novajoin" to only enable
for train and earlier as novajoin is no longer supported for recent
branches[1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/features/tls-introduction.html

Change-Id: I3155bfb54f8cd227a6a3d3f9aaffd777e2074418

commit_message:
Refactor iDRAC OEM extension manager calls

- Re-usable helper created to avoid duplication.
- Although there is only one manager for system in known iDRAC systems
still iterate through collection for future changes.
- Restructured exception raising and error logging for better feedback.
- Removed some unit tests to avoid duplication that is covered by
method specific unit tests

Change-Id: I03fdb48e47c9557c207a20ee876eccf3f3459d9f
(cherry picked from commit 39cd751a9063ae04e1649ccbca5496c3754d706e)

This deals with, at least, the case when an EC frag is being PUT, the client transaction has written the non-durable data file, then an ssync process renames it to be a durable data file. commit_message:
Fixes disabling fwaas

Commit 00e7c8b added support for disabling fwaas but
forgot to remove the firewall plugin from service_plugins
once the fwaas package has been removed. This patch fixes
that.

Change-Id: I75fdd192144138fa5bf09c278d5507ca8c5366d1
Closes-Bug: #1934129
(cherry picked from commit a144a583196ef6b655a7ad60eaab2f8f97a6a5ee)

subject: Drop tenant_id templating from v2 endpoint
messages:
[{'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-07-28 05:56:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-07-28 06:10:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-07-28 14:00:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-07-28 17:20:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Looking at what is written in devstack plugin of manila, removing project_id requires API version >=2.60. Are we sure this doesn't affect usage of cli commands ?

This would not affect manilaclient which uses the latest api version, but I'm concerned with openstack cli which uses the minimum api version by default AFAIK."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-07-29 15:57:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> Looking at what is written in devstack plugin of manila, removing project_id requires API version >=2.60. Are we sure this doesn't affect usage of cli commands ?

Hi Takashi, 

Thanks for the question. Nope - this is a backwards compatible change in the v2 API, and a tricky one at that. We didn't make any effort in manila to prevent users working with older v2 microversions from dropping the project_id; so, as long as the cloud supports API version 2.60, we can use an endpoint that doesn't contain the project_id. For example:

  curl -i -X GET http://shared-file-system.com/share/v2/shares/detail -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H "X-Openstack-Manila-Api-Version: 2.0" -H "User-Agent: python-manilaclient" -H "Accept: application/json"

works, and you could still use the project_id templating on newer API versions, like:

  curl -i -X GET http://shared-file-system.com/share/v2/af2838436f3f4cf6896399dd97c4c050/shares/detail -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H "X-Openstack-Manila-Api-Version: 2.63" -H "User-Agent: python-manilaclient" -H "Accept: application/json"


The API responds appropriately depending on your request, no matter the micro-version. 
 
> This would not affect manilaclient which uses the latest api version, but I'm concerned with openstack cli which uses the minimum api version by default AFAIK.

both clients are compatible with this change - but the caveat is the same - the cloud must support API version 2.60, the user (or client) can specify whatever API version they want. 

Wallaby release of manila supports upto API microversion '2.63'.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-07-29 16:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Hi Goutham,

Thank you for your clarification.
That makes sense and clears my concern.'}]

(project_id). This change was made to
accommodate interactions by system scoped users.

System scoped users cannot interact with an

because system scoped tokens cannot be resolved
to a particular tenant_id by definition. More
information regarding this change is captured
in the release notes for the project [2] and
the API reference [3].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila/+/773709
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/manila/wallaby.html#prelude

Change-Id: I77c81b79539ccedb7dbac3e30f6eb257b5f6e082
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Drop tenant_id templating from v2 endpoint

Manila's wallaby release [1] made it possible for
the v2 endpoint to not include a tenant_id
(project_id). This change was made to
accommodate interactions by system scoped users.

System scoped users cannot interact with an
endpoint that needs the "tenant_id" templating,
because system scoped tokens cannot be resolved
to a particular tenant_id by definition. More
information regarding this change is captured
in the release notes for the project [2] and
the API reference [3].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila/+/773709
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/manila/wallaby.html#prelude
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/shared-file-system/#shared-file-systems-api

Change-Id: I77c81b79539ccedb7dbac3e30f6eb257b5f6e082
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

Add a share network resource to shared file system

including list, create, delete, get and update to
shared file system share networks.

commit_message:
Remove periodic-stable jobs

As nova-powervm is not actively maintained and the periodic stable jobs
are failing for several months now, to free up some CI resource, this
patch removes the periodic-stable-jobs template.

Change-Id: I8ad218b2e2d76a739ed5a01ffe6a05414634428f

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-29 06:39:23.000000000', 'message': 'ci-workarounds/get_extra_logging.yaml : avoid grep failure

If this grep doesn't match, the task returns a failure and it causes
the job to abort with POST_FAILURE.  I think more info is generally
helpful and you can always grep "netstat" on the file manually; thus
remove the grep to avoid suprious failure.

Change-Id: I189a0a8be25cb12e946d8ac58667b287f9698064
'}]
commit_message:
ci-workarounds/get_extra_logging.yaml : avoid grep failure

If this grep doesn't match, the task returns a failure and it causes
the job to abort with POST_FAILURE.  I think more info is generally
helpful and you can always grep "netstat" on the file manually; thus
remove the grep to avoid suprious failure.

Change-Id: I189a0a8be25cb12e946d8ac58667b287f9698064

commit_message:
[ceph-provisioner] Add check for empty ceph endpoint

This is to add check to find out empty ceph mon endpoint while
generating ceph etc configmap for clients.

Change-Id: I6579a268c5f4bc458120dda66667988e5a529ee9

- pmem-tempest-plugin-filtered-multi-node http://52.27.155.124/13/740213/1/check/pmem-tempest-plugin-filtered-multi-node/8185f5f/ : FAILURE in 32m 22s'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2020-07-09 11:01:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-43695 : SUCCESS in 59m 41s'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-08-26 18:28:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is good. Can you add a unit test though?'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-08-26 18:29:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 32006, 'date': '2020-08-27 01:52:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> This is good. Can you add a unit test though?

Thanks for the help. I will add a unit test, but I am not familiar with unit test now, and I dont know how to implement it.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-08-27 08:04:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > This is good. Can you add a unit test though?
 > 
 > Thanks for the help. I will add a unit test, but I am not familiar
 > with unit test now, and I dont know how to implement it.

Take a look at the 'test_get_guest_config_aarch64_with_graphics' test in 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'. You could generalize this to support MIPS too. Something like:

  def _test_get_guest_config_with_graphics(
      self, architecture, mock_path_exists, mock_numa, mock_storage,
      mock_get_arch,
  ):
      ... rest of test

  def test_get_guest_config_aarch64_with_graphics(self):
      self._test_get_guest_config_with_graphics(fields.Architecture.AARCH64)

  def test_get_guest_config_mips_with_graphics(self):
      self._test_get_guest_config_with_graphics(fields.Architecture.MIPS64)"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-07-29 15:50:06.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

The MIPS architecture is EOL now. Even if it wasn't, this needs work including a rebase. As a result, I'm abandoning this. If you'd like to pick this up again, please restore the change or ping one of us to do so"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-09 10:01:37.000000000', 'message': 'Add USB keyboard to support for MIPS architecture

I use hosts with MIPS architecture to run openstack
I launched an instance, then open the console, but can not use the keyboard.
From the nova source code, I got a message :
   Add USB keyboard as PS/2 support may not be present on non-x86 architectures.
Then I made a patch, and it worked.

Change-Id: I7bc70c32d3d789bf0f88f897595a917156dbdd79
Closes-Bug: #1886930
'}]
commit_message:
Add USB keyboard to support for MIPS architecture

I use hosts with MIPS architecture to run openstack
I launched an instance, then open the console, but can not use the keyboard.
From the nova source code, I got a message :
   Add USB keyboard as PS/2 support may not be present on non-x86 architectures.
Then I made a patch, and it worked.

Change-Id: I7bc70c32d3d789bf0f88f897595a917156dbdd79
Closes-Bug: #1886930

commit_message:
docs: Note the ``hw_numa_nodes`` image property

This requires updating the link to Glance's image metadata document.

Change-Id: I595b800ae0c2a6a1a35c87a7d80236cf503cc8d8
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1763761

commit_message:
nova.exception._clean_dict should use oslo_utils.strutils

nova.exception_wrapper._cleanse_dict will also remove sensitive
keys identified in oslo_utils.strutils._SANITIZE_KEYS

Change-Id: Ia40a110b4cf97163b9de19280d88eebfa5e44839
Closes-Bug: #1487038

The following lines cause errors incorrectly. The regex pattern should be fixed.

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/a7773846974e66ac9bd9e5343a02d6e805d2ecaa/nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_vm_util.py#L1159
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/a7773846974e66ac9bd9e5343a02d6e805d2ecaa/nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_vm_util.py#L1200'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-08 10:26:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Good finds, Takashi-san. However, I don't think they can be addressed by changing the regex. If we e.g. require the line to contain "Mock", then we miss things like 

 m = Mock(
     spec='foo')

What we can do is update the docstring to suggest that, if you really have a kwarg called "spec" whose value is a string, you need to cheat by doing:

 the_val = 'actual_spec_string'
 foo.assert_called_with(spec=the_val)

Would that be acceptable?'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-08 11:19:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-04-08 12:25:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It is not correct. If 'logical_line' is used for the check, the example is not missed.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-23 18:31:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-23 18:32:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-05 16:08:50.000000000', 'message': "Hacking N363: Don't use spec[_set]='string'

The behavior of Mock(spec=foo) or Mock(spec_set=foo) when foo is not a
list is to interpret foo as a class or instance and derive the set of
attributes you're allowed to get (spec) and/or set (spec_set) based on
dir(foo). Thus if foo is a string, your mock will be set up to look like
a string (with attributes like index, find, startswith...).

This is almost certainly not what you intended to do, so this commit
introduces hacking rule N363 to forbid it.

For example, if you said:

    Mock(spec='nova.objects.Instance')

...what you almost certainly meant was:

    Mock(spec=nova.objects.Instance)

If you actually want your mock to be specced like a string, say:

    Mock(spec=str)

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/unittest.mock.html#the-mock-class

Change-Id: If0e37e7ee4a13c1c86ea9076e5b37194aec3c0cf

    Mock(spec='nova.objects.Instance')

...what you almost certainly meant was:

    Mock(spec=nova.objects.Instance)

If you actually want your mock to be specced like a string, say:

    Mock(spec=str)

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/unittest.mock.html#the-mock-class

Change-Id: If0e37e7ee4a13c1c86ea9076e5b37194aec3c0cf
"}]
commit_message:
Hacking N363: Don't use spec[_set]='string'

The behavior of Mock(spec=foo) or Mock(spec_set=foo) when foo is not a
list is to interpret foo as a class or instance and derive the set of
attributes you're allowed to get (spec) and/or set (spec_set) based on
dir(foo) [1]. Thus if foo is a string, your mock will be set up to look
like a string (with attributes like index, find, startswith...).

This is almost certainly not what you intended to do, so this commit
introduces hacking rule N363 to forbid it.

For example, if you said:

    Mock(spec='nova.objects.Instance')

...what you almost certainly meant was:

    Mock(spec=nova.objects.Instance)

If you actually want your mock to be specced like a string, say:

    Mock(spec=str)

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/unittest.mock.html#the-mock-class

Change-Id: If0e37e7ee4a13c1c86ea9076e5b37194aec3c0cf

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Iabad24aab27d651aee33afbc03007cb47b47a320

when SIGTERM is sent to nova-compute process.

commit_message:
[DNM] Implementing graceful shutdown.

This allows nova-compute to finish creating all currently spawning instances,
when SIGTERM is sent to nova-compute process.
This is done by putting all spawning instances in a separate thread
pool, which uses [compute]/max_concurrent_builds config opt for setting the
size of the pool.
For larger number of VM's `graceful_shutdown_timeout` in `nova.conf` must be
set to a bigger number in order to work.

Change-Id: Ibf83877ca0936c8e78582c310f0b107a3b1e78d3
Closes-Bug: #1798326

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-23 11:35:28.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] libvirt: Remove support for floppy drives

Nova allows a floppy device type via these image metadata properties:

   - hw_floppy_bus=fd
   - hw_rescue_device=floppy

However, emulated floppy drives are vulnerable.  See the infamous
"VENOM" CVE[1] where a floppy disk controller could cause crash a guest.
Latest is this[2] "null pointer dereference" vulnerability in QEMU's
floppy drive emulator.

Ideally, we might want to do a deprecation-followed-by-removing-it.  I
first began adding a warning, but then I remembered that back in
2019-February I asked[3] on the list if anyone relied on floppy drives
(due to 'VENOM' at that time), I heard nothing except an ACK by a
developer for the removal.  Though, I realize that not every Operator
would pay attention to the list.

TODO:

 - Work out the details of versioned object bump for deprecation /
   removal fields.DiskBusField() in nova/objects/image_meta.py
 - Tests - at a min, fix the below:
    - test_get_device_name_for_instance_device_type
    - test_find_disk_dev
    - test_success_get_disk_bus_for_disk_dev
    - test_get_device_name_for_instance_device_type
 - Release note
 - Fix documentation in Glance

[1] https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-3456

[2] https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2020-09/msg07779.html
    [PATCH v2] fdc: check null block pointer before r/w data transfer

[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/002479.html
    [nova] Floppy drive support  does anyone rely on it?

commit_message:
[WIP] libvirt: Remove support for floppy drives

Nova allows a floppy device type via these image metadata properties:

   - hw_floppy_bus=fd
   - hw_rescue_device=floppy

However, emulated floppy drives are vulnerable.  See the infamous
"VENOM" CVE[1] where a floppy disk controller could cause crash a guest.
Latest is this[2] "null pointer dereference" vulnerability in QEMU's
floppy drive emulator.

Ideally, we might want to do a deprecation-followed-by-removing-it.  I
first began adding a warning, but then I remembered that back in
2019-February I asked[3] on the list if anyone relied on floppy drives
(due to 'VENOM' at that time), I heard nothing except an ACK by a
developer for the removal.  Though, I realize that not every Operator
would pay attention to the list.

TODO:

 - Work out the details of versioned object bump when deprecating /
   removing allowable values for hw_floppy_bus / fields.DiskBusField()
   in nova/objects/image_meta.py
 - Tests - at a min, fix the below:
    - test_get_device_name_for_instance_device_type
    - test_find_disk_dev
    - test_success_get_disk_bus_for_disk_dev
    - test_get_device_name_for_instance_device_type
 - Release note
 - Fix documentation in Glance

[1] https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-3456

[2] https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2020-09/msg07779.html
    [PATCH v2] fdc: check null block pointer before r/w data transfer

[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/002479.html
    [nova] Floppy drive support  does anyone rely on it?

blueprint: remove-support-for-floppy-disks
Change-Id: I7be52886f9fba931ce582b1a949a21b2ffde7eac
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
